loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk thread of various colors.

loans.name: Manrique

texts.es:
Manrique tiene 42 años de edad y  vive su familia en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo, que es urbano y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

Manrique dio inicio a su negocio, para ayudarse en los gastos diarios y sacar adelante a su familia. Ha visto el apoyo de su esposa y está seguro de que su lista de clientes crecerá y podrá dar abasto con todas sus necesidades.

Es por eso que Manrique está solicitando un crédito de 200,000.00 (doscientos mil colones), para asi comprar madera que este en pie, luego venderla procesada y lista para construir.

Manrique es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su segundo préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Manrique is 42 years old and lives with his family in a community in the Hatillo district.  This is an urban residential area, however it is experiencing a growing amount of commercial activity. This is mainly concentrated in the commercial centers, where there are a large number of furniture stores, tortilla makers, bakeries, bookstores, mechanics and car workshops, gas stations, dentists, pharmacies, medical offices, bars, restaurants, shops and printers.

Manrique says that he started his business to help with daily expenses and to move his family ahead in life.  His wife helps him, and he is confident that his client list will grow and that he will be able to cover all his needs.

This is why Manrique is requesting a loan of 200,000 (two hundred thousand) colones, so that he can purchase raw lumber that he will sell once it's processed and ready to use in construction.

Manrique is a member of the Communal Bank of Hatillos, which is one of EDESA's 150 communal banks in Costa Rica.  This is his second loan with Empresa, and he is very thankful for all the support that has been provided to him.

loans.use: to sell processed lumber for construction.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, ella se dedica a vender  tamales y ropa, el negocio de tamales lo aprendió de su madre y el de ropa lo inicio junto a su esposo, todos los días vende tamales por las tardes y la ropa de lunes a domingo.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para damas y caballeros como: blusas, faldas, short, pantalones, camisas, de esa forma tendrá más variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes  el cual  le ayudara a obtener mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Rosa es mantener siempre su negocio y tener un local propio en el futuro, y darles  una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and three children.  She sells tamales and clothing. She learned her tamale business from her mother and she started her clothing business together with her husband. She sells tamales every day during the afternoons and she sells clothing from Monday to Sunday.

She needs a loan to buy women and men’s clothing such as blouses, skirts, shorts, pants and shirts. In this way, she will be able to offer her customers a greater variety of merchandise and this will help her earn a higher income.

Rosa’s dream is to continue with her business,  to have her own shop in the future, and to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shorts, pants and shirts for both sexes.

loans.name: Oscar Leonel

texts.es:
el sr. Oscar Leonel tiene 34 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de 1 hijo, su actividad principal es la caficultura, tiene 6 años de experiencia. el lugar en donde el vive es apto para este tipo de actividad, gracias a su negocio a logrado salir adelante con su familia. 
Oscar utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel solar, en su comunidad no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y piensa que contando con un panel solar su hijo va a tener más posibilidades de salir adelante en el ámbito estudiantil, aprovechar mas tiempo de la noche para estudiar.
tambien desea tener entretenimiento por medio de television.
texts.en:
Sr. Oscar Leonel is 34 years old, married and the father of one son. His principle work is coffee growing in which he has had 6 years of experience. The place he lives is suitable for this type of cultivation and thanks to his business he has succeeded in getting ahead with his family.

Oscar will use the loan to buy solar panels for his home. In his neighborhood they do not have electricity and he believes that owning solar panels will provide his son more possibilities to succeed as a student, since he will be able to spend more time studying at night. Oscar would also like to have television as a form of entertainment.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, D. 39 años; es una mujer feliz. Vive en compañía D. Fabián, su esposo desD. hace 13 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Ancalayo. El trabajo constante es lo que más le gusta. Por ello desD. joven trabajó en la agricultura con la siembra D. papa y maíz en pequeñas cantidades, ya que siembra solo por temporadas. Según cuenta la actividad que más le gusta a ella es la ganadería, posee 3 vacas grandes y 4 terneras pequeñas, que hace poco nacieron.  D. ellas extrae 10 litros D. leche fresca que venD. a 2 soles por unidad. Con ello ya tiene una ganancia diaria para el hogar, la que también administra con las vitaminas que compra para que la vaca proporcione más leche. Además su esposo trabaja como albañil en construcciones D. casas. Ahí obtiene una ganancia mensual considerable, con los que solventan algunos gastos del hogar e incluso pueden ahorrar algo D. dinero para sus hijos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Norma D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus cultivos D. papa.
texts.en:
Norma, 39, is a happy woman.  She lives with Fabián, her husband of 13 years.  Together they have 3 sons they are raising in their own home, located in the neighborhood of Ancalayo. She greatly enjoys always having work to do. Consequently, since she was a young woman she has worked in agriculture, planting potatoes and corn in small quantities since she only plants seasonally. 

Norma tells us that she most enjoys cattle raising and she owns 3 large cows and four recently born small calves. From them she extracts 10 liters of fresh milk which she sells for 2 soles a unit, thus earning a daily income for the home as well as covering the cost of vitamins so that the cows produce even more milk. In addition, her husband works as a bricklayer in home construction. Thus he earns a very nice monthly income which is used to meet some household expenses and enables them to save some money for their sons.

This is Norma’s second loan with MFP and she awaits their assistance so that she can concretize her plans. She promises to make her payments on time. As well, she is grateful to be a part of the association because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. Upon receiving support, Norma will invest the money requested in the purchase of natural fertilizer to spread on her potato plants.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for her potato plants.

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, es madre soltera, vive con tres hijos de 11,9 y 1 año de edad, ella se dedica a crecer cerdos y venderlos, en su casa tiene la granja el cual atiende todos los días, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar dos cerdos pequeños y poder crecerlos y luego venderlos a buen precio y así obtener mejores resultados en sus ganancias.
El sueño de Ernestina es siempre tener el negocio estable y darle una mejor vida a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Ernestina is the single mother of three children aged 11, 9, and 1. She earns her living raising and selling pigs. Her farm is next to her house and she works there every day but not to any established timetable.

Ernestina needs a loan so she can buy two young pigs, then raise and sell them for a good price, and earn good money from the process. Her dream is to have a stable well-established business so that she can provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy two young pigs

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Francisco tiene 54 años, esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos, Juan tiene una experiencia de 15 años en la caficultura, muchas personas de esta zona se dedican a este tipo de actividad, la tierra y el ambiente son aptos para el cultivo del cafe, esta es una de las 3 mejores zonas en donde se producen los mejores granos de cafe de Honduras. Don Juan utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel solar, pues en su comunidad no cuentan con energía eléctrica, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que podra eliminar los candiles y las candelas que son dañinas para las vias respiratorias.
Juan aprovechara mas la noche para realizar actividades ya sean personales o de trabajo.
texts.en:
54-year old Sr. Juan Francisco is married and has four children. He has worked in the coffee-growing business for fifteen years, like many people in the area. The land and the climate are very suitable for growing coffee, and the area is one of the three best parts of Honduras for quality grains.

Juan plans to use the loan to buy a solar panel as his community does not have electricity. He says he’d be very happy to get rid of his oil lamps and candles which are harmful to the respiratory system. As well, he’d be able to take advantage of the evenings to do other personal or work-related activities.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Ana Lisseth

texts.es:
Ana, vive con sus tres hijos de las edades 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender antojitos como: yuca, pasteles, atol y por las tardes vende pupusas en su casa, los dias sábado y domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una cocina para hacer comida rápida como: papitas, hamburguesas, tacos y a si podrá obtener  clientes y tendrá más ingresos económicos. 
El sueño de Ana es tener su negocio estable e incrementar en sus ingresos y que sus  hijos sigan estudiando y darles una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her three children aged 9, 7, and 5. She sells street food such as yucca, pies, atol (a local warm drink made from corn), and on Saturday and Sunday afternoons she sells pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) from her house. 

Ana needs a loan to buy a stove so that she can make fast food such as fries, hamburgers, and tacos. In this way she would gain more customers and earn more money.

Her dream is to have a well-established business and a bigger income. She hopes that her children will continue at school and that she will be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 60 años, es una mujer admirable. Enviudó hace 20 años, del que fue su esposo José, con quien tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos: Manuel en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Cajas Chico. A pesar de criar sola a sus hijos, ella mantiene la misma fortaleza de siempre. Con la venta de verduras crió a sus hijos, de los que se siente orgullosa. Su trabajo es arduo, pues tiene que viajar a diferentes lugares y en días estratégicos, donde existe feria. Es así que de lunes a domingo trabaja sin descanso. Cuenta que ganan un promedio de 70 a 80 soles diarios. En todo este tiempo logró adquirir un lugar propio en el mercado de su ciudad de donde también vende. Por otro lado recibe el apoyo de su último hijo quien trabaja como albañil construyendo casa. Ahora desea abrir un negocio con el que pueda mantenerse sin preocupaciones por el resto de su vida.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Las Wanquitas” y este es el décimo séptimo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de verduras por canastas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana, 60, is an admirable woman. She was widowed twenty years ago from her husband José with whom she had three children, of whom she lives with only one, Manuel, in their own home, located in the Cajas Chico district. In spite of raising her children alone, she still has the same strength as always. She used vegetable sales to care for her children, of whom she feels proud. Her work is demanding, since she must travel to various locations and on strategic days when there is a market. Thus she works from Monday to Friday without a rest. She comments that she earns on average 70 to 80 soles a day. During all this time she was able to purchase her own spot in the market of her city from which she also sells.  Also, she receives the support of her youngest son who works in construction building homes. Now she wishes to open a business with which to support herself without worries for the rest of her life. She belongs to the communal bank "Las Wanquitas." This is the seventeenth loan with MFP, where she is happy because she will have financial support and thus be sure of advancing in her work. 

She promises to comply with her payment plan. Additionally she appreciates being part of her association because all its members are responsible persons who give each other a lot of support. Juana, upon receiving her loan, will invest the money requested in the purchase of vegetables by the basket for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
el sr. Vicente Tiene 38 años, esta casado y es padre de 5 hijos, Vicente se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 7 años, ha adquirido un amplio conocimiento en la rama de la caficultura. Don Vicente utilizara el credito para comprar su propio panel solar, en su aldea no cuentan con energía eléctrica y toda su vida se ha alumbrado con candiles, los cuales son nocivos para la salud.
con esto mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Vicente is 38 years old, married, and the father of five children. Vicente devotes himself to coffee farming which he has done for seven years. He has acquired an extensive knowledge in the area of coffee farming. 

Don Vicente will use the loan to purchase his own solar panel. In his township they do not have electric energy and his whole life he has used oil lamps for lighting, which are harmful to one's health. Thus his family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos ella se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado, todos los días miércoles y domingos son los dos días de comercio.
Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como: tomate, chile, zanahoria, repollo, el cual le permitirá tener más variedad y ofrecerles a sus clientes y obtener mejores ingresos. 
El objetivo de María es mejorar sus ingresos  y optar por un mejor estilo de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and two children. She devotes herself to selling fruits and vegetables in the market. She sells every Wednesday and Sunday which are the two market days. 

She needs the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as tomatoes, chile peppers, carrots, and cabbage. This will allow her to offer more variety to her customers and make better earnings. 

María's objective is to improve her income and choose a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, chile peppers, carrots and cabbage.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de las edades 13,10 y3 años de edad, ella se dedica vender tortillas el oficio lo aprendió de su madre y vende refrescos de diferentes sabores en su casa  todos los días.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar más materiales como: leña, maíz, y productos para los refrescos, de esa manera podrá aumentar en sus ventas diarias y tener más clientela.
El sueño de Verónica es mejor su calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband and three children of the ages 13, ten and three. She devotes herself to making and selling tortillas. She learned the trade from her mother, and sells various flavors of drinks from her home every day.

She will use the loan to purchase more materials such as firewood, corn, and ingredients for making the drinks. Thus she will able to increase her daily sales and have more customers. 

Verónica's dream is to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, and ingredients for making refreshing drinks.

loans.name: Ivan Antonio

texts.es:
el sr. Ivan Antonio esta casado y es padre de 3 hijos, Ivan se dedica al cultivo de cafe, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y nos manifestó que toda su vida se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra por qué fue lo que su padre le enseño.
Don Iván utilizara el credito para comprar un panel solar, el ha anhelado en toda su vida gozar de luz en su casa y manifiesta que al obtenerlo va a mejorar su estilo de vida y así sus hijos podran aprovechar mas las noches para estudiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Ivan Antonio is married and the father of three children. Ivan devotes himself to cultivating coffee and has eight years of experience in this line of business. He told us that his whole life he has dedicated himself to working the earth because that is what his parents taught him. 

Don Iván will use the loan to purchase a solar panel. He has been hoping his whole life to enjoy light in his home and states that, with it, his lifestyle will improve and his children will be able to make better use of the evenings for their studies.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Sabas

texts.es:
Sabas, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposa y 5 hijos, los cuales son dependientes, él se dedica a atender una granja de cerdos, esta actividad requiere de mucho cuidado y tiempo, para estar pendiente del crecimiento de los animales y por cualquier enfermedad, él aprendió desde muy pequeño, cuando ayudaba a sus padres.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo, lo invertirá en la compra de dos cerdos y también concentrado, la compra le ayudara para adquirir estos nuevos miembros para la granja y así ir aumentando el negocio.
Sabas pretende con la ayuda de los préstamo, multiplicar el número de cerdos, para disponer y vender a los clientes.
texts.en:
Sabas works raising pigs.  He lives with his wife and five children, who are dependent.  He works taking care of a pig farm.  This job takes a lot of care and time to be aware of the growth of the animals and any illness.  He learned the job at a young age when he was helping his parents.

Currently he is requesting a loan to invest in buying two pigs and also feed.  The purchase will help him get these new additions for the farm and so continue improving the business.

With the help of the loan, Sabas hopes to increase the number of pigs to provide and sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and also feed.

loans.name: Herminta

texts.es:
La señora Herminta tiene 34 años de edad, convive con su esposo en unión libre, tiene 2 hijos, reside en la comunidad rural de Los Achotes en el municipio de Omoa, Cortés.
Sus hijos están estudiando en la escuela primaria.  Como actividad económica tiene una tienda de novedades y relojería, ella trabajan en el negocio atendiendo los clientes con las ventas y el esposo se dedica a la reparación de relojes en la misma tienda.
Doña Herminta comenzó su negocio hace 6 años, ha manejado varios prestamos, actualmente ha solicitado su decimo préstamo el que piensa invertir en surtir la tienda con productos como relojes, anillos, pulseras, cadenas y accesorios para el cabello.
Ella planea seguir creciendo en su negocio y buscar la estabilidad económica para apoyar en el estudio a sus hijos y contribuir con los gastos del núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Herminta, 34, lives with her husband in a common law union and has two children.  She lives in the rural community of Los Achotes in Omoa municipality, Cortés.

Her children are going to elementary school.  Her economic activity is a store selling watches and accessories.  She works in the store tending to customers and her husband is in charge of watch repair in the same store.

Herminta started the business six years ago and has managed several loans.  She’s currently requesting her 10th loan that she plans to invest in stocking her store with watches, rings, bracelets, chains and hair accessories.


She plans to continue growing in her business looking for economic stability to support her children’s schooling and contribute toward family expenses.

loans.use: to buy personal accessories and watches.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta D. 61 años, es una mujer valiente. Enviudó hace 3 años D. Oscar, su esposo. Ambos tuvieron 8 hijos a los que cuidaron con amor. Ahora ella vive en casa D. su hija Sara, ubicada en la ciudad D. Tambo. Ella se siente sola, pues su eterno compañero, murió. A raíz D. ello comenzó a vivir con su hija, a la que quiere mucho. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, continua en ganándose la vida como cocinera en una mina, donD. prepara 30 platos D. comida casera, le va muy bien en su negocio, pues la comida por esa zona es escasa y le brinda mayor demanda. Además gracias a su dedicación la contrataron como cocinera en el cafetín D. la mina, ahí le pagan 25 soles diarios, los que suman a la pensión mensual que recibe por la muerte D. su esposo. Eso la llena D. tranquilidad y alegría, “esperaré en paz, pues el resto que me queD. D. vida, no preocuparé a mi familia”, comenta tranquila. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jacinta D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. víveres, trucha y cuy para la preparación D. sus platos D. comida.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 61, is a courageous woman.  She was widowed three years ago by Oscar, her husband.  Together they had eight children whom they cared for lovingly.  Now she lives in her daughter Sara's house, located in the city of Tambo.  She feels alone because her eternal companion died.  Because of this she began to live with her daughter, whom she loves very much.

But since she is a hardworking woman, she continues earning a living as a cook in a mine, where she makes 30 dishes of homestyle food.  Her business is going very well for her since food is scarce in that area and that creates greater demand for her.  Also, thanks to her dedication they hired her as the cook in the cafe in the mine, where they pay her 25 PEN daily, which she adds to the monthly pension she receives for the death of her husband.

This fills her with peace and happiness: "I will wait peacefully, since for the rest of my life I will not be a worry to my family," she comments quietly.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  She is pleased to be part of her association because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

When she receives the support, she will invest the money requested in buying supplies, trout, and guinea pigs to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, trout, and guinea pigs to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, oil and fruit.

loans.name: Alexis Bladimir

texts.es:
Alexis, es empleado y vive con su esposa y su hija, él es vendedor en una empresa pero trabaja en agricultura siembra de granos básicos como: frijoles y maíz el contrata a personas para el trabajo no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas como: abono, semilla, herbicidas para obtener mejores cosechas y estén libres de plagas para luego venderlo obtener mejores ingresos y dejar una parte para su familia.
El objetivo de Alexis es que a su familia no le falte nada que tenga el sustento diario y poder darle lo mejor a su esposa y a su hija .
texts.en:
Alexis is an employee and lives with his wife and daughter.  He is a salesman for a firm but also works as a farmer growing basic grains like beans and corn.  He hires helpers to do the work and does not have a fixed work schedule.

He will use the loan to buy farm supplies like manure, seeds and herbicides to obtain better harvests that are pest-free to then sell and obtain better income and to keep part of it for his family.  

Alexis’ goal is that his family lack nothing and has daily nourishment and to be able to give the best to his wife and daughter.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Cinthia Gabriela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar vive la señora Cinthia, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene  hijos, pero tiene una hija de su esposo en otro compromiso que es como si fuera de ella ya que la tiene desde pequeñita. El marido trabaja en cerrajería. Ella estudia Ing. Industrial en una Universidad de Manabí.

Ella a más de dedicarse a sus estudios con mucha devoción y entrega también se  dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días ya que además de vender por su localidad también les vende a sus compañeras y conocidas en la Universidad, ella les deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene 6 meses  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, con lo que le queda de ganancia ella se ayuda para sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio y además le han ayudado a salir adelante en sus estudios.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ejercer su profesión.

En la fotografía aparece nuestra socia con la hija de su esposo.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed back then, the “Con Esperanza” (With Hope) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

Cinthia, 22, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has no children yet but she has a daughter her husband had in a previous relationship that’s like her own since she’s had her since she was a baby.  Her husband works in a metal shop.  She’s studying Industrial Engineering at a university in Manabí.

Besides dedicating herself to her studies she also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories) with much dedication and steadfastness.  She works every day because in addition to selling in her neighborhood she also sells to her classmates and acquaintances at the university.  She sells on credit and collects payment every weekend.  She’s been in this line of work for six months and is doing very well.  She uses her profits to help with her studies.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  This is the fifth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because she started her business with one of the loans and they have also helped her get ahead with her studies.  Her dream is to finish her education and start working in her profession.

In the photo she appears with her husband’s daughter.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Carmen Emerita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene 61 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijas aun viven con ella, una de ellas está casada y vive con su familia. Su esposo trabaja en Santa Elena.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa interior por catalogo de la marca Leonisa y  productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También  ella tiene un local en el centro en el cual vende helados, local que no hace mucho abrió y en el que también aprovecha para vender todos sus productos. Lleva seis años trabajando en ventas y recién 6 meses con su heladería.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa interior y helados. Lleva 8 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido financiar sus negocios.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en sus negocios.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds because of the great amount of this fruit that existed back then, the “Mujeres Con Esperanza” (Women with Hope) communal bank meets every fifteen days.

We met Carmen, 61, here.  She’s married and has five children who are all adults now.  Two of her daughters still live with her.  One of them is married and lives with her family.  Her husband works in Santa Elena.

She is a housewife who, in order to earn her own resources, sells underwear of the Leonisa brand via catalogue and also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She also has a locale downtown where she sells ice-cream, a locale she opened not long ago and that she also uses to sell all her other products.  She’s been working in sales for six years and only six months in her ice-cream shop.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, underwear and ice-cream.  She’s been in the communal bank 8 years and likes it because thanks to the loans she’s been able to finance her businesses.  Her dream is to continue with her businesses.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, underwear and ice-cream.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta, vive con su esposo y una hija, ella administra una tienda donD. ofrece productos D. primera necesidad, este negocio lo aprendió a manejar por la misma necesidad D. tener una entrada D. dinero en su propia casa, lleva 7 años en él, y ha venido mejorando.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. zapatos, sandalias, pólvora, ropa, esta compra le servirá para surtir el negocio, ofreciendo nuevos productos y que sean D. uso para los clientes, ya que no solo encontraran comestibles, sino también accesorios para vestir.
La aspiración D. Berta es mantener el negocio bien surtido, generar más ganancias a través D. los productos y sobre todo vivir dignamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha lives with her husband and a daughter.  She runs a store where she sells basic staple items.  She learned how to run it because she needed to have a source of income at home.  She’s had it for seven years and has been steadily improving.

She is asking for a loan to buy shoes, sandals, powder and clothes.  This purchase will help her stock the store having new items that are useful for her customers because they won’t just find foodstuffs but also clothing accessories.

Bertha hopes to keep the store well-stocked to generate higher profits through the products and, above all, to live with dignity with her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, powder and clothes.

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es: Patricia, se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere comprar semilla de marañón, ya que ahorita se pone a mejor precio y así lograra tener disponible para  mantener su negocio. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron porque incrementaron sus ganancias, esto le permitió lograr mejor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en: Patricia decided to take out another loan because she wants to buy cashews because their price is better now and she’ll be able to have on-hand supply to stay in business.  The previous loans helped her because she increased profits which led to better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy cashews.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: Pamela, de 20 años es una mujer joven y trabajadora. Vive junto a su papá Javier, su mamá Sara y sus tres hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo del Tambo. A su corta edad, ella comenzó a trabajar para mantener sus estudios de Psicología en una universidad privada, pues su mayor deseo es convertirse en toda una profesional. De esa manera desde hace algunos años, comenzó en el negocio de fotocopiados, con una máquina que adquirió hace poco. Por las tardes, durante todos los días trabaja sin descanso; pues en las mañanas se dirige a la universidad donde tiene clases. Según cuenta los fines de semana son los días donde ella vende en mayor cantidad. Por lo que a veces tiene que faltar en sus estudios. Pero eso no es una desventaja para ella, porque estudia constantemente. Ahora desea culminar sus estudios con honores. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Pamela de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de tinta, hojas y una máquina anilladora para su negocio.
texts.en:
Pamela, 20, is a young, hardworking woman.  She lives with her father, Javier, her mother, Sara and her three siblings that she cares for in her own house located in Tambo Annex.  At her short age she started working to pay for her Psychology studies at a private university because her greatest wish is to become a great professional.  

A few years ago, therefore, she started a photocopying business with a machine she acquired a short time ago.   She works tirelessly with no days off every afternoon because mornings she attends classes at the university.  According to what she tells us, her sales are best on weekends so she sometimes has to miss classes.  But this is not a disadvantage for her because she constantly studies.  She now wants to graduate with honors.

This is her fist MFP loan and she hopes for your collaboration so that she can make her plans happen.  She promises to make her installment payments.  She likes being part of her association because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Pamela were to receive your support, she will invest the money to buy ink, paper and a ring binding machine for her business.

loans.use: to buy printer ink, paper and a machine to ring bind documents.

loans.name: Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Agustín tiene ya más D. diez años dedicándose a la reparación y ventas D. lavadoras y secadoras D. ropas. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar las partes D. las maquinas y así poderlas vender a un buen precio, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el ingreso del negocio, porque es la fuente D. ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Don Agustín desea mejorar su negocio y las ventas y así podrá tener más ganancias, y podrá darle es estudio necesario a su hijo.
texts.en: Agustín has been repairing washing machines and clothes dryers for over ten years.  He asks for a loan to buy spare parts for the machines so that he can sell them at good prices because he currently lacks the necessary capital for this investment and he doesn’t want to decapitalize the business because it’s his family’s source of income. Agustín wants to improve the business and sales so that profits will be higher and be able to proviD. his son with the necessary education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for washing machines and clothes dryers.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene 64 años y vive con su familia, en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo que es eminentemente urbano y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

Faustina tiene como meta, el poder hacer unos cambios para mejorar su casa, pero no ha podido ya que ha tenido problemas económicos, lo que quiere decir que se le hace muy difícil realizar su proyecto por financiamiento propio.

Es por eso que Faustina está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de 400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción, para asi mejorar su hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Faustina es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su primer préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Faustina, 64, lives with her family in a community in Hatillo district that’s mostly urban and residential.  However, it’s the object of growing commercial activity concentrated primarily in the commercial centers.  A large number of furniture stores, tortilla shops, bakeries, bookstores, metal and auto shops, gas stations, dental offices, pharmacies, medical offices, bars, restaurants, stores and print shops have located there.

Faustina’s goal is to be able to make some home improvements but she’s not been able to because of economic problems which means that it’s very difficult for her to do the project with her own financing.

Because of this Faustina is asking for a 400,000 colones loan to buy building materials and supplies to improve her home and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Faustina is a member of the Hatillo communal bank one of EDESA’s 150 communal banks in Costa Rica.  This is her first loan with the firm and she gives thanks for all the help she’s been given.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Amistad Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Irma,tiene 5 en edad escolar hijos  es casada  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desD. hace 1 año y 8 meses, junto al grupo “Prosperidad y Amistad”, grupo conformado por 8  personas  que pusieron este nombre con el deseo D. prosperar. Irma  trabaja Alquilando combis desD. hace 7años este trabajo surge porque elL. deseaba darle una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación  ha logrado tener  4 combis propias que le ha permitido tener mayor  ingresos y así darles a sus hijos una mejor educación  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para dar mantenimiento a sus combis. Sabemos que Irma  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos  D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Irma has five school aged children.  She’s married and has been working with Edaprospo for a year and 8 months in the “Prosperidad y Amistad” (Prosperity and Friendship) group which has 8 members; they named it that because they wish to prosper.

Irma has been working leasing minivans for 7 years.  The business arose from her desire to proviD. a better quality of life for her children.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication she’s managed to acquire four minivans of her own that have led to higher income and she’s been able to proviD. her children with a better education.  In order to continue to grow, she’s asking for a new loan to service her minivans.  We know that Irma will reach her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo’s loans will help her.

loans.use: to service her minivans.

loans.name: Lomas Del Calvario (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal lomas Del Calvario  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la Señora Eloísa, tiene  25 años  de edad, está separada y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 

Ella para solventar sus  gastos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y ropa interior, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, realiza sus ventas al contado y también deja a crédito a sus clientes más confiables, a los mismos que cobra cada 15 días. Ella compra su mercadería en Guayaquil, lleva tres años con este negocio y vende con su papá el cual lleva como 20 años en el negocio y fue quien le incentivó a entrar en el mundo del comercio.

Este crédito fue para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y ropa interior. Es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que va a recibir.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The “Lomas del Calvario” (Calvary Hills) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a zone noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast day of Saints Peter and Paul and for its rich historic culture enclosed by its mountains.

This is a group of people that decided to join together and form this communal bank which is very useful for them because with the loans they are able to improve the small businesses they have.  They are in a variety of activities like commerce, services and food sales, among other activities.

We met Eloisa, 25, here.  She’s separated and has no children.  She lives in her parents’ house. To cover her expenses, she’s a merchant.  She sells all types of clothes and underwear door to door.  She sells for cash and also on credit to her most trustworthy customers.  She collects payments from them every 15 days.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and has been in business three years.  She sells with her father who has been in the business about 20 years and who encouraged her to go into the world of commerce.

This loan was to buy pants, blouses, shirts and underwear.  It’s her first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the help she’s going to get.  Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina tiene 24 años y vive con su familia, en una comunidad del distrito de Hatillo que es eminentemente urbano y residencial, sin embargo es objeto de una creciente actividad comercial, concentrada principalmente en los centros comerciales. Se ha ubicado gran cantidad de mueblerías, tortillerías, panaderías, librerías, talleres mecánicos y automotrices, gasolineras, dentisterías, farmacias, consultorios médicos, bares, restaurantes, tiendas e imprentas.

Carolina tiene como meta, obtener más ingresos y pagar sus estudios por medio de este negocio, para superarse y llegar a ser una gran profesional.

Es por eso que Carolina está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de 300,000.00 (trescientos mil colones), para la compra de mercadería como zapatos y ropa, para asi mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Carolina es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Hatillo, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su primer préstamo con la Empresa y da muchas gracias por toda ayuda que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Carolina, 24, lives with her family in a community in Hatillo district that is primarily urbane and residential.  However, it’s the object of increasing commercial activity concentrated mostly in the commercial centers.  A large number of furniture stores, tortilla shops, bakeries, bookstores, metal and auto shops, gas stations, dental offices, pharmacies, medical offices, bars, restaurants, stores and print shops have located there.

Carolina’s goal is to obtain more income to pay for her studies through this business; to get ahead and become a great professional.  Because of this, Carolina is asking for a 300,000 (three-hundred thousand colones) loan to buy merchandise like shoes and clothes to improve her and he family’s quality of life.

Carolina is a member of the Hatillo communal bank one of EDESA’s 150 communal banks in Costa Rica.  It is her first loan with the firm and she gives thanks for all the help she’s been given.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Exal Evir

texts.es:
El señor Exal Evir tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la animación de eventos sociales como son fiestas y promociones de negocio. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar otro equipo de sonido ya que uno de sus hijo quiere también dedicarse a eso y como tiene varios eventos así poder cumplir con todos su clientes y que lo puedan recomendar. 
Don Exal Evir desea mejorar los ingresos de su negocio con esta inversión y con el cual pagara el crédito, ya que su esposa la señora Esther se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrica.
texts.en:
Exal Evir has been entertaining at social events like parties and office promotions for over five years.  He’s asking for a loan to buy another sound system because one of his sons wants to go into the same business and since he has several events he’ll be able to satisfy all his customers and they will recommend him further.

Exal Evir wants to improve his business’ income with this investment and will use it to repay the loan since his wife, Esther, will take care of family expenses with the salary she earns working in a factory.

loans.use: to buy a sound system.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a rickshaw transport business and a clothes sales business where he gives transport services to the local people and sells clothing to them. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located at Nakuru town. He describes his biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds and inflation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand the two businesses within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a residential house.

loans.use: To buy a stock of clothes to boost the clothing sales business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a married man. He has 4 children, with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a milk sales business where he sells milk to the local people. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a bicycle that will facilitate the running of the milk sales business. His business goal is to grow it and buy a car that will be used to run the business within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle to facilitate the running of the milk sales business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 41 años vive en la urbanización Mercurio D. la ciudad D. El Alto, cuenta con casa propia, cuenta con un ingreso por sueldo D. profesora con 10 años D. experiencia laboral, considerando que el codeudor el hijo cuenta con ingresos independientes por venta D. artefactos con experiencia D. 1 año.

La cliente con el transcurso del tiempo ahorró dinero D. donD. con ese pequeño ahorro tiene un pequeño patrimonio en bienes muebles e inmueble.

El destino del crédito esta destinado a capital D. inversión, refacción D. vivienda y trámites D. la misma en Derechos Reales, institución que le da legalidad a los papeles D. su vivienda.
El cliente tiene una deuda, en cuanto a su experiencia mejorar su nivel D. ingresos, cuenta con actitud D. pago y emprendimiento en su vida personal y laboral.
texts.en:
Hilda, 41, lives in the Mercurio urbanization of the city of El Alto; she has her own house.  She earns a salary as a teacher with ten years’ work experience.  Her son is co-borrower.  He has his own source of income selling appliances; he has one year experience.

Over time the client was able to save money that she used to acquire real estate and other assets.  The loan will be used as investment capital, to do some home improvements and to do the paperwork in Derechos Reales, the institution that legalizes home ownership documents.

The client has a debt, experience in improving income levels, has a payment attituD. and is enterprising both in her personal and her work life.

loans.use: to pay for paperwork to register ownership of her house.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca de 61 años de edad, es soltera por viudez desde hace 15 años, tiene 6 hijos de 9,16, 18,19, 22 y 24 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural de Santa cruz de Yojoa.

Tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Cultiva maíz, frijoles y café, tiene una manzana de cultivo y la producción la vende en el mercado local, la mayor parte llegan los compradores a su casa. Esta finca se la dejo su esposo y es bien administrada por ella y sus hijos, dedicándole el tiempo necesario al cultivo.
Este es el sexto préstamo y los a utilizado para la siembra y mantenimiento de la finca de café y cultivo de maíz y frijoles.  A logrado tecnificar mas su finca y cubrir gastos de educación de sus hijos.
Su meta es mejorar el cultivo para sacar buenas cosechas y poder arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 61 years old and single for the last 15 years due to widowhood .  She has six children who are 9, 16, 18, 19, 22 and 24 years old.  She lives in a rural village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

She’s been farming for 30 years.  She grows corn, beans and coffee.  She has a manzana [Central American land measure] of farmland and she sells her crops in the local market; most of her buyers come to her home to buy.  Her husband left her the farm and it’s well managed by her and her children; they dedicate the necessary time to the crops.

This is the sixth loan and she’s used them for coffee, corn and bean crops maintenance.  She has managed to increase the technology level in her farm and cover the educational expenses of her children.  Her goal is to improve the crops to have good harvests and be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, etc.

location.town: La Boquita, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Gabriela le está haciendo falta el techo en dos cuarto, desean colocarla de concreto ya que es mas segura y doradora. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar el material que es cemento, varilla, arena y pagarles a las personas que se encargara de elaborar la losa. 
Dona Gabriela se dedica al cuidado y intención de sus dos hijos y de su esposo el señor José Luis.  Quien se encargas de los gastos familiares y escolares Don José Luis con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como supervisor de una compañía. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y que el patrimonio este en buenas condiciones y seguro para ellos.
texts.en:
Gabriela's household needs a roof for two rooms. They want it to be made of concrete as it is safer and durable. She is requesting a loan to buy the following materials: concrete, rods and sand as well as paying the workers charged with making the flagstones. 

Gabriela takes care of her two children. Her husband José Luis, with his salary as a company supervisor, is in charge of the family's expenses and education. They wish to improve their children's quality of life and have their estate in good and safe conditions for them.

loans.use: to install concrete flagstones in two rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and raw materials for baking.

loans.name: Mary Nyambura

texts.en: Mary is a 31 year-old married woman. She has 2 children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 7 years. She describes herself to be honest and determined. She operates a hawking business where she sells sweets, biscuits, ground nuts, juice etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy sweets, biscuits, ground nuts and juice in large quantities. Her business goal is to grow it and own a business premises to run her business instead of hawking within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business into wholesale and put up rental units.

loans.use: To increase her stock of sweets, biscuits, ground nuts and juice

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo las socias y los socios del Banco Comunal La Nueva Esperanza se reúnen cada quince días, lugar donde la mayoria de su gente se dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les va a servir de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van a mejorar los pequeños negocios que tienen. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, agricultura y cría de animales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 6 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer.
 
Ella es  una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y de productos Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, a ella le encanta vender sus productos ya que son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, a place where a majority of the people work in agriculture and raise animals, the partners of the Banco Comunal La Nueva Esperanza ("Communal Bank The New Hope") meet every fifteen days.  

This is a group of people that decided to unite and form this communal bank that will help them a lot, as the loans will allow the group members to improve the small businesses that they have. They work in diverse businesses, such as commerce, agriculture, and raising animals.  

Here, we meet Flor, who is 29 years old and lives in a common law marriage through which she has four children, aged 13, 10, 8, and 6, who are in school.  Her husband is a driver.  

She is a very good housewife who sells underwear and Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women) to acquire her own income. She works three days a week, selling her products on credit and collecting money each week.  She has worked in this business for a year, and it is going very well.  She loves to sell her products as they are very good.  

This loan is to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and underwear.  This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because the repayments are easy to make.  

Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Peter Maina

texts.en:
Peter is a 43-year-old married father of three children ranging in age from 10 years to 21 years. Describing himself as determined, Peter has operated a  business providing transport services to the people of Nakuru for the past six years.  High fuel prices and harrassment by the traffic police are his biggest business challenges.

Peter has requested a Kes 50,000 loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle. His business goal is to buy a 29-seat mini bus within five years, and he hopes to be able to pay school fees for  his college-going daughters in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 7 months to 13 years. She describes herself as humble and honest. She operates a shoe sales business, where she sells shoes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a shopping center. 

Florence describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her inventory of shoes. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of shoes.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man, 33 years old, with a 6-year-old child. His wife is a businesswoman. Boniface runs a general store, in which he sells detergents, beverages, food items and cereals. The business is located in a shopping center. He has had the business for a year now and its helping him to raise his young family. 

Due to the economy now, the challenge Boniface faces is the drastic increase in prices of cereals. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to increase the inventory of cereals. His future dream is to acquire bigger business premises. He also hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He describes himself as honest and outgoing.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of cereals.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 24-year-old married woman. She has two children, a 1-year-old and a 3-year-old. She describes herself to be religious and committed. 

Divina operates a general store, where she sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, food items and beverages. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Divina will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her inventory of general retail items. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open other shops in different areas.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of general retail items.

loans.name: María Aracely

texts.es:
La señora María  tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, reside en la comunidad  urbano marginal Terencio Sierra, sector Chamelecón en San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Desde hace 8 años inicio su negocio vendiendo calzado, actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas, caballeros y niños. Sus dos hijos menores están estudiando por lo que ella se esfuerza por aumentar sus ganancias.
Ella ha solicitado su segundo crédito para surtir su negocio con ropa y zapatos nuevos, considera que al ofrecer variedad de productos, sus clientes aumentan y sus ganancias también.
Doña Maria va continuar luchando para sacar adelante a sus hijos con el estudio y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 38, is a single mother; she has three children and lives in the marginal urban community of Terencio Sierra, Chamelecón Sector in San Pedro Sula, Cortés.

She started selling shoes 8 years ago and now also sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes.  Her two younger children are still in school so she works hard to increase profits.

She has requested her second loan to stock her business with new shoes and clothes.  She believes that by offering a variety of products her customer base will increase as will her profits.  María will continue to strive to raise her children and provide them education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Petronillar

texts.en:
Petronillar is a 25-year-old woman. She has one child. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy, and God fearing. Petronillar operates a beauty salon business, where she provides hair and beauty services to the local people. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a shopping center. 

Petronillar describes her biggest business challenge to be her clients' low purchasing power. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy salon equipment. Her business goal is to grow her business and open other outlets within five years.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Dhahabu Nyadzua

texts.en: Dhahabu is a 25-year-old woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 12 years. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy, and God fearing. She operates a clothing sales business, where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes. Her business goal is to grow her business and open other outlets within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her sandwich sales.

loans.name: Hendriter

texts.en:
Hendriter is a 27-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be honest, trustworthy and God fearing. 

Hendriter operates a charcoal sales business, selling charcoal to the local people. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy charcoal. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 42-year-old man. He has four children with ages ranging from 1 year to 6 years. He describes himself to be religious and God fearing. He operates a grocery store, where he sells vegetables. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a shopping center. He describes his biggest business challenges to be insufficient funds and low sales. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy vegetables. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will diversify and open a general store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is married with one child. Amor is 29 years old and lives in Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City.

Amor is a farmer and grows coconut farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase home construction materials to finish her house. 

Amor has been a member of PMPC for just this year. In the future, Amor hopes to expand her coconut farm.

loans.use: to purchase home construction materials.

loans.name: Claudia Jeanneth

texts.es:
Claudia, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad, vive en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.

Desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica familiar (pulpería), como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, churros, manteca, verduras.  Adicional a los productos comestibles, vende variedades como champú, pasta dental, cosméticos y achinería como juguetes, plásticos etc. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como secretaria en una empresa privada.

Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo para surtir y le han ayudado mucho para incrementar su inventario y diversificarlo con otros productos, los resultados han sido buenos.
Su meta es ampliar mas el negocio y ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia, age 39, is the single mother of a 17 year old son.  She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

For three years she has had her business of selling food staples (grocery store) like rice, beans, sugar, churros, lard, and vegetables.  In addition to selling food products, she sells miscellaneous goods like shampoo, toothpaste, cosmetics, toys, and plastic goods, etc. 

She worked previously as a secretary for a private company.

She has requested her second loan to stock her business.  The loans have helped a lot to increase her inventory and diversify with other products.  The results have been very good.

Her goal is to expand her business more and to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, lard, vegetables, soft drinks, rice, beans, and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: El Señor Freddy vive en la zona de  Pucara Grande en la provincia de Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba, hace 2 años que Freddy compró el terreno en cual actualmente vive, donde pudo construir 3 cuartos. Mantiene a su familia con el ingreso de servicios de transporte que hace con su propio taxi. En una primera instancia el terreno que compro hace 2 años, lo hizo con financiamiento bancario, ahora terminó de pagar su préstamo, y estuvo buscado un nuevo préstamo para terminar de construir su casa, levantar muro y colocar puerta de garaje. Por recomendación escuchó de los créditos que ofrece KIVA a través  de nuestra Institución. Es así, que tramitó el crédito para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in the Pucara Grande zone of Cercado province in Cochabamba department. Two years ago, Freddy bought the land where he currently lives, and he built three rooms there. He supports his family with income from transportation services that he provides using his own taxi. 

To start out, the land that he bought two years ago was purchased using financing from a bank. Now he has finished paying off that loan, and he was looking for a new loan to complete the construction of his house, put up a wall, and add a garage door. Through a recommendation, he heard about the loans that Kiva offers through our institution. Because of that, he applied for the loan to complete the construction of his house.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his house.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús solicita  un préstamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa y tapar las cuarteaduras de las paredes; por que en temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo y las paredes se están deteriorando. Jesús quiere prevenirse antes  que el problema se agrave  y tenga que gastar más de lo previsto al igual que sus hijos puedan contagiarse de alguna enfermedad por la humedad que se genera. Para poder cubrir los gastos él y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora y para el gobierno 10 horas de Lunes a Viernes y algunas ocasiones se queda tiempo extra para recibir más dinero. Jesús  es padre  de dos niños, de los que quiere brindar mejor patrimonio en que puedan vivir cómodamente. Para que el pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar el impermeabilizante y material de construcción para tapar las cuarteaduras.
texts.en:
Jesús is asking for a loan to weatherproof the roof on his house and to seal cracks in the walls because during the rainy season water seeps in because the roof and walls have deteriorated.  

Jesus wants to take steps before the problem worsens and he has to spend even more than anticipated; he also wants to keep his children from acquiring some illness due to the dampness that’s generated.

To cover costs, he and his wife work in an assembly plant and for the government 10 hours Monday through Friday and sometimes stays on extra hours to earn more money.

Jesús is the father of two children that he wants to provide a better asset for so that they can live comfortably.  To carry out this project, he needs to buy weatherproofing and building materials to seal the cracks.

loans.use: to weatherproof and to seal some cracks in the walls.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es: Marisela  de 43 años está soltera y  tiene 1 hijos que depende económicamente de ella,  tiene siete años viviendo en una casa de interés social que adquirió, misma que aun le siguen descontando en su empleo vía nomina. Para Marisela más importante ofrecer a su familia un lugar cómodo para vivir, desde que inicio a vivir coloco tarimas al frente de su domicilio para darles un lugar seguro a sus hijos donde pudieran jugar y hoy en día nos solicita el apoyo para quitarla y levantar una barda de block la cual protegería sus intereses y su familia. Para construir la barda necesita comprar block, arena, varillas y pagar al albañil.
texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Marisela is single and has one child that is financially dependent on her. For seven years she has lived in a house that she purchased in subsidized housing. She is still paying for this house with payroll deductions from her salary. 

To Marisela, the most important thing is to provide her family with a comfortable place to live. When she started living here, she put up pallets in front of her home to give her children a safe place to play. Today she is requesting help to remove these and build a cinder block wall that would protect her property and her family. In order to construct the wall, she needs to buy cinder blocks, sand, and rods, as well as pay the bricklayer.

loans.use: to build a wall for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy security equipment to install on his windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, grains, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a 26-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be quiet, confident and time conscious. He operates a produce sales business, selling farm produce. He has been involved in this business for two years and employs one staff member. His business is located in an agricultural area. 

Bonface describes his biggest business challenge to be an insufficient water supply. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy water pumps, a sprinkler and horse pipes. His business goal is to expand his business to large scale farming within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have more children and give them a quality life.

loans.use: to buy water pumps, a sprinkler and horse pipes.

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Voeun, 54, and his wife, Channa, 51 (pictured together), live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1982 and have five children - two sons and three daughters.  

Voeun and Channa are mango farmers. Voeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to maintain his mango farm by buying pesticide and fertilizer. He will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer to maintain his mango farm, and to build a restroom for his family's use.

loans.name: Charles Mulyungi

texts.en: Charles is 27 years old, married and has three children who range in age from one to four years old. He is committed to succeed in his business, which consists of selling produce he grows on his farm. He has been in this business for three years, and his main problem is an insufficient water supply. Charles is applying for a loan for Kes 40,000 to buy pumps, sprinklers and pipes. His goal is to go into large-scale farming within the next five years. In the future, he also hopes to buy a van to transport his produce to market.

loans.use: to buy pumps, sprinklers and pipes.

loans.name: Mirian Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Marian tiene 48 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo,  tiene 3 hijos (22, 21 y 12), reside en la comunidad  de La Danta en Choloma, Cortés.
Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, sus dos hijos mayores están casados y su hijo menor esta en la educación primaria.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como granos básicos (maíz, frijoles y arroz), maseca, sopas, manteca, huevos y refrescos. Hace aproximadamente un año  estableció su negocio (mini pulpería) con la ayuda de un financiamiento.
Actualmente ha solicitado un segundo préstamo para surtir con productos de la canasta básica. Ella se siente motivada, ya que su nivel económico ha  cambiado, espera que en el futuro pueda apoyar a su hijo con la educación y logre graduarse en la secundaria.
texts.en:
Marian, age 48, lives with her common-law husband and her three children (22, 21, and 12).  She lives in the La Danta community in Choloma, Cortés.  Her husband is a bricklayer, her two oldest children are married, and the youngest child attends elementary school.

She sells food products like basic grains (corn, beans, and rice), “maseca” (instant corn dough), soup, lard, eggs, and soft drinks.  Approximately one year ago she established her business (a mini grocery store) with the help of a loan.

She has now requested a second loan to stock up on staple products.  She is motivated because her financial position has changed.  In the future she hopes to be able to support her son’s education and manage to have him graduate from high school.

loans.use: to buy staple products.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is 31 years old, married and has three children who range in age from three to 12 years old. She is committed to improve and expand her business, which consists of selling produce she grows on her farm. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and now has two employees. She describes her biggest business challenge as an insufficient water supply. She will use this Kes 30,000 loan to buy sprinklers. Her goals for the future are to expand into large-scale farming and educate all of her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy sprinklers for her farm.

loans.name: Sideth

texts.en:
Sideth (in the photo), 29, is single, lives with his widow mother in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sideth sells flower and small trees at home. He wants to expand his business. Hence he is asking for a loan of $700 to buy more flowers and small trees for sale.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more flowers and small trees for sale.

loans.name: Mercedita Group

texts.en:
Mercedita is 50 years old and lives in Del Pilar, Baliangao. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Mercedita has a business selling grocery items. She earns about 3200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Mercedita's group has requested a loan of 14,500 PHP; she will use her portion to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Mercedita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. 

Mercedita is the leader of a two person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 65 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Luzvilla has a business selling bread. She earns about 3500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Luzvilla has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase five sacks of flour and other ingredients. 

Luzvilla has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Syna

texts.en:
Syna (in the photo) sells grocery items at home. Her husband Sarith is a motor taxi driver. They have been married for more than four years and have two young children, one son and one daughter. The family is living in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sarith wants to fund a new business producing shoes for sale because he has just finished learning this skill, but he does not have the capital to buy materials to launch his business. Hence, Syna is applying for another loan of $1,000 to help her husband to buy materials.

loans.use: To help her husband buy materials to launch a business producing shoes.

loans.name: Rosa Migdalia

texts.es:
Rosa Migdalia, tiene 38 años de edad y casada desde hace 18 años, tienen 4 hijos de 12, 14, 16 y 18 años de edad, quienes actualmente estudian, vive en la aldea la Peña, Santa Bárbara. Su esposo es  caficultor.

Doña Rosa, tiene 18 años de trabajar en el cultivo de café y adicionalmente a la producción de banano, también hace viveros de café para la siembra. Esta experiencia la tiene desde toda su vida. En la familia lo hacen por tradición y porque es una forma de vivir y poderse desarrollar y educar a sus hijos. Ya tiene un área de terreno cultivado de 2 manzanas. El producto de café lo venden en pergamino (grano) húmedo y los bananos lo venden por tallo. A esta actividad le dedica todo el tiempo necesario.
Es primer préstamo que obtiene con ODEF, y es para invertir en fertilizantes, abonos y herbicidas para darle un mejor mantenimiento a la finca de café y banano, y cultivar la tierra disponible que tienen.
texts.en:
Rosa Migdalia, 38, has been married for 18 years; she has four children who are 12, 14, 16 and 18 years old who are currently in school.  She lives in the village of La Peña, Santa Bárbara and her husband’s a coffee grower.

Rosa has been working growing coffee for 18 years and she also grows plantain; in addition, she sets up coffee nurseries for planting.  She’s had this experience her entire life.  It is her family’s tradition because it’s a way of earning a living and be able to develop and to educate her children.  She has a two-manzana [Central American unit of land measure] plot of land under cultivation.  They sell the coffee as damp beans and the plantain is sold by the bunch.  She dedicates all the necessary time to this activity.

This is her first ODEF loan and she will use it to buy fertilizer, manure and herbicide to provide better care for her coffee and plantain plantations and to cultivate the available land they have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom (in the photo) and her husband, Sarom, are vegetable and flower farmers. Sarom also drives a motor taxi when he is free. 

The couple lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1987 and have five sons--two are construction workers, one is a monk and the other two attend school.

Mom is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike because the old one was stolen.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Canntha

texts.en:
Canntha (pictured with her loom), 37, is a widowed mother with two daughters: one has full-time employment and the other attends school. She lives in a village on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
