Canntha is a silk weaver. She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She will use a part of the loan to fill in the land in front of her house. Because there are some tiny ponds behind her house, so she needs to fill it in.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and fill in the land in front of her house.

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en: Lyndie is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Philippines. For the last four years, she has earned a living by growing rice, and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. Lyndie has been a member of PMPC for five years and hopes to save enough money to meet all of her family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Vibol

texts.en: Vibol earns a living by building houses out of wood. He has been married since 2003 and now has two children, one of whom is old enough to attend school. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He is applying for a loan for $1,000 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: to build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom earns a living as a weaver. She supplements the income she earns at this trade by also selling rice and food in her village. Her husband, Thy, earns a living by building houses out of wood. They live on an Island on the MeK. River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sarom is applying for a loan for $1,000 to buy materials for her weaving business. She will use a part of the loan to improve and upgrade the shop from which she sells rice and food.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a weaving business and improve a shop where she sells food.

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 38 años de edad, convive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos (12 y 9 años), reside en la comunidad  rural de La Cosmul en San Pedro Sula, Cortés.
Doña Maria se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maíz, y venta de verduras en menor escala. Su esposo es motorista, sus dos hijos  están  estudiando la educación primaria y le ayudan a su madre en los espacios de tiempo libre.
Hace 4 años que inicio con su negocio, antes ella se dedicaba a trabajo asalariado, por lo que decidió independizarse económicamente y aportar recursos económicos a su hogar.
Ella ha solicitado su primer préstamo el que piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas (maíz, cal y leña). Espera en un corto plazo utilizar sus ganancias para dedicarse al negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives in a common law relationship with her husband; they have two children (12 and 9 years old) and live in the rural community of La Cosmul in San Pedro Sula, Cortés.

María is a corn tortilla merchant and also sells vegetables in small scale.  Her husband’s a driver.  Her two children are in elementary school and they help their mother in their free time.

She started the business four years ago; she used to have a salaried job but decided to become economically independent to provide income for her home.

She has requested her first loan that she plans to use to buy raw materials to make the tortillas (corn, lime powder and firewood).  She hopes in the short run to use her profits to go into food sales business

loans.use: to buy raw materials (corn, lime powder and firewood) and vegetables.

loans.name: Chankrisna

texts.en:
Chankrisna (in the photo) and her husband, Moa, live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Moa is a fisherman. In addition, he is also a rice farmer and drives a horse cart to carry goods for his fellow villagers. Chankrisna sells the fish that her husband catches in the local market. They have been married since 1989 and have three sons and four daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and the other four attend school.

Chankrisna is asking for a loan of $500 to support her husband’s fishing business by buying one more boat and additional fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy one more boat and additional fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Srifas

texts.en:
Srifas (in the photo) sells the fish that her husband catches in the local market. Her husband HaM. is a fisherman. They also run a business selling recycling materials. They have a family of daughters: three attend school and the others are still young and stay at home. The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Srifas is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to assist in her husband’s fishing business by purchasing one more boat and a boat motor.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying one more boat and a boat motor.

loans.name: Kundy

texts.en:
Kundy (in the photo) is a motorbike repairman and a blacksmith. His wife Sreytauch is now a weaver. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2007 and have two young sons. 

Kundy hopes to continue his business, so he is applying for another loan in the amount of $500 to purchase additional motorbike spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase additional motorbike spare parts.

loans.name: Adilaida

texts.en:
Adilaida is 53 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with 7 children. 
Adilaida has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
Adilaida has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Melony

texts.en:
Melony is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband and children. Melony is a very patient person and a hardworking mother. She will do anything for her family.

Melony has a retail shop located in their village. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to purchase different products that she can offer to the village to have additional income. For the future, Melony dreams that someday her business will expand so that she can meet all the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy spices, snack foods, canned goods and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She is 53 years old and lives in Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Rosalyn has been in her business for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to purchase fish to sell to customers at her fish stall.

Rosalyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to expand her fish-selling business in her locality.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Lorilane

texts.en:
Lorilane is 36 years old, and married with two adult aged children. She has a retail shop located in her village where she can sell a variety of products. Her spouse works as a farmer. Lorilane is well known as a very responsible mother in her village.

Lorilane is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase can goods, noodles, spices and snack foods for her store. Lorilane wishes that someday she can achieve her dreams for her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 35 years old and lives in Bongbong, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married with two school aged children. Alma has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase housing materials like lumber, plywood, nails, etc., for home improvement. Alma has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Alma hopes to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials like lumber, plywood, nails, etc., for home improvement.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is 47 years old and lives in Dimaluna, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married with four children. Saturnina has a shop that sells canned goods, soap ,toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan to pay the school tuition fee of her son. Saturnina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Saturnina hopes to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee of her son.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 36 years old, and married with three children. She presently lives at Lower Sto. Nino, Mahayag, Zamboanga del sur. She has a vegetable garden, and she has had this business  for almost two years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her gardening business.

Liza has been a member of Paglaum Multi- Purpose Cooperative for three years. In the future, Liza hopes that she can provide for the needs of the family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her gardening business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a married woman. She’s a very hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and improve herself more every day. She sells cosmetics and clothes. She chose this work because she enjoys selling. She’s been working for about a year and earns PHP 3,500 per month.

Jessica is asking a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products for her business to offer. Jessica's main dream is to have a comfortable life for her family. She’s very grateful for the loan granted because she’ll be able to reach her goals with it.

loans.use: to buy dresses, lotion, shampoo and detergent for her business.

loans.name: Beun

texts.en:
Beun (in the photo) is a weaver and her husband, Chamroeun, is a security guard. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have one young son. 

Beun hopes to continue her weaving business because it a traditional profession. Hence she is asking for another loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Myrna Criado's Group

texts.en:
Myrna is married with three adult-aged children. She is 64 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City.

Myrna sells fertilized duck eggs (balut) to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more duck eggs for her balut business. 

Myrna has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Myrna hopes to save money for business expansion. 

Mryna is the leader of a four-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more duck eggs.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en:
Lam (pictured) is a weaver and her husband, Bunthoeun is now a construction worker. They have been married since 1990 and have three children - two sons and one daughter. One is a construction worker, one is a housekeeper and another one attends school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Lan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get work.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is a farmer and she also sells fish at the market for additional income. She is 48 years old and has seV. children. She lives in a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years. This is the second loan she has received from VisionFund after her first loan was completely paid. 

Pheap is requesting a loan to cultivate her rice farm. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the crop yield and be able to sell at a good price, so that she can feed her family and make her family's living conditions better.

loans.use: to cultivate her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Seun is a weaver and farmer, while her husband, Nem is a builder of wooden houses. They live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have seven five sons and two daughters. 
 
Seun is requesting another loan of $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm (corn and tomato). 

Photo: Seun is pictured with her loom, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 56 years old and lives in Tuyabang Alto,Oroquieta .She is married and has 4 children. Loreta has a general store business, earning approximately PHP 1,500 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock for her store.

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to own a grocery store. Loreta hopes that her children can finish their studies. Loreta is a hardworking mother, an honest person and a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Coralyn

texts.en:
Coralyn is a devoted mother. She expresses her commitment and full devotion to both her business and her family. Coralyn is 35 years old and has three children, two of whom attend school. Her spouse is a jeepney operator.

Coralyn established a business to boost her spouse's income. She makes peanut butter, tamarind, milk and ube candies (made from purple yam) and sells them to a nearby retail store. She had been doing this for almost five years. Profits gained from the couple's businesses are used for school fees, meals and electric bills. Part of the income is also used as revolving capital for Coralyn's candy making business. Coralyn is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 because she has insufficient funds to buy more ingredients, such as skimmed, condensed and fresh milk, sugar and flour, to be used in her candy making business. She wants to increase her sales to acquire more profit. In the future, Coralyn would like to improve her sales and soon offer her candies to larger establishments such as grocery stores and food stalls.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to use in her candy making

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Borey, 42, is a silk weaver. Her husband, Saroeun, 51, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1989 and have four children - one son and three daughters. One of their children has full-time employment in Phnom Penh City and the others attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Borey is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to get to work.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch, 41 years old, and her husband, Launh, 39 years old, live in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have two children -a son and a daughter. One is a garment worker and the other attends school. 

Toch and her husband are rice and lotus farmers. Toch is asking for a loan of $500 in order to buy seeds and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy has been involved in farming for almost 15 years. He is 48 years old and married, with two school-going children.

Zaldy patiently manages his corn farming business to earn a living. Though he has, at times, suffered from difficulties in life, he is still grateful because he is able to sustain all of his family's needs. One of his goals is to plant more corn in order to gain higher yields. However, due to his household expenses and his children's school fees, he cannot buy the necessary farm supplies.  Zaldy is therefore asking for a loan of PHP 27,000, which would really help him a lot  in buying farm supplies and paying for labor to transplant and plow the corn field. Zaldy hopes to make his dream come true, allowing him to send his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and to pay for labor

loans.name: Rong

texts.en:
Rong (in the photo), 56, is a weaver and she also buys additional finished silk and cotton products from other weavers in her village to sell. Her husband, Chhom, 66, is a security guard. The couple has been married since 1979 and has four children - three sons and one daughter. Three are married and live outside the family home and the other one has full-time employment. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Rong is asking for a loan of $600 to add to her own money to buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.use: to add to her own money to buy a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en:
Sokhea is from a rural area of Tbaung Khmum district, about 150 kilometers from Phnom Penh city. She is 27 years old, married and has three children. They are not in school yet. She is a farmer and she has been farming for 5 years. To better support her living, she also plants cassava. 

Sokhea has been with VisionFund since 2008. The loan from VisionFund has made a positive impact for her family. Now she is requesting her fourth loan. She will use this loan to rent a plot of land for a cassava plantation. With this loan, she hopes to make more cassava (starchy tuberous root) which will enable her to earn more income to better feed her children and build some savings for future needs and her children's studies.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land for a cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao is a weaver, while her husband, Norng, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2000 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreymao is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a fence around her house. She will also use a part of the loan to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and buy weaving materials for her business.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 65 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 8 children. Florita has a business selling spices, earning approximately PHP 10,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more spices to sell.

Florita has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Florita hopes to have a space in the market in order to earn money to use for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more spices

loans.name: Raylyn Group

texts.en:
Raylyn is 26 years old and lives in P-1 Cogon, Ozamis City. She is married and has two children - one school-aged and one adult-aged. Raylyn has operated a shop selling canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. for almost one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional stock for her general store.

Raylyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to save money for her children’s education. Raylyn is the leader of a two person group, with each member having her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Sren

texts.en: Sren, aged 31, is a hairdresser in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. He is married and has 3 children. Sren started his business 25 years ago. This is his first loan with VisionFund. He wants to buy hairdressing supplies and build a shop for his business. As a result of this loan, he hopes to have more customers and earn more income for his family's expenses and business.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing supplies

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Balai Rakyat 4 Group

texts.en: Hikmah and her husband sell plastics and used cardboard. She has been doing this since 2008. She enjoys doing this business because she can easily find the plastics and used cardboard from companies. One challenge that she has is on rainy days, when her things can get wet. Hikmah is married with one son in fourth grade and one daughter in third grade. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She will use this loan to buy materials to build a stand to sell plastics and used cardboard. She wants to have enough savings and hopes she can give a better education to her children. Other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses which include selling nasi uduk (an Indonesian rice dish), selling fruits and selling snacks.

loans.use: to pay for materials to build a stand to sell plastics and used cardboard

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos.  Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura, en una zona rural, la cual cuenta con servicios básicos.

La actividad que realiza María,  es la crianza de ganado porcino y aves de corral los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local, también los sacrifica para vender en carne. Realiza esta  actividad desde hace más de 6 años en una parte posterior de su casa. 
También se dedica a la agricultura contando con 1 has de terreno agrícola el cual tiene sembrado de limón.  Este terreno le fue entregado por su padre como herencia.

María es una mujer emprendedora, y para poder realizar sus actividades ha decidido obtener un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, esto con la finalidad de comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ganado y aves, con lo cual obtendrá un buen peso y tamaño de sus animales para luego venderlos a un mejor precio y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 36, is single and has three children.  She lives in her own house located in Tambogrande district in Piura Department, a rural zone that has basic utilities.

María’s activity is raising pigs and barnyard fowl that she fattens up for subsequent sale in the local market; she also butchers them to sell the meat.  She’s been carrying out this line of work for over six years in her back yard.   She also farms.  She has a one hectare plot of farmland planted with lemons.  She got this lot as an inheritance from her father.

María is an enterprising woman and in order to be able to do her activities has decided to get a 600 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock and fowl so that they will attain good size and weight so that they can be sold later for a better price and she can continue to grow in the business.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Arly

texts.en:
Arly is 44 years old and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has four children. Arly has been selling fish daily for six years, earning PHP 2,500 monthly. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fish to sell to the market.

Arly has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase  fish to sell to the market

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert, a 30-year-old farmer who lives in Pinto Alfonso Lista village, has been managing his corn farm business and he has had this business for four years. Patience and hard work are his instrument to make his farm business grow allowing him to pay all of his family expenses, and since he is single, he take care of his parents and look after their farm.

In order to continue increasing his profits, Albert is requesting a loan of P27,000 to buy farm supplies to make his farmland more productive. He is hoping that someday he could expand his cornfield to earn greater profits to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his corn-farming business.

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 9 Group

texts.en:
Yayan is a widow. She has been selling things such as oil, sugar and snacks from a kiosk in front of her house. Now she wants to add gallons of water and liters of gasoline to her kiosk to sell as well. Her business has been going well, but she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to hopefully help continue to grow it. The income from her business enables her to feed her family.

Yayan hopes someday she can become an agent of the gasoline company and sell wholesale to customers like herself now. She also hopes that all of her children and grandchildren grow up with the opportunity and finances to attend school.

loans.use: to pay for gallons of water and liters of gasoline to resell in a kiosk

loans.name: 06.02.03 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Liên is 37 years old and married with 2 children. Liên lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Mrs Liên has a stall selling votive objects (objects displayed or deposited in a sacred place for broadly religious purposes). Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make votive objects for sale. With her business profit, Liên hopes for her children to do well in school, to remodel her house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Liên is the group leader of the 06.02.03 Đông Vệ solidariy group, which consists of 3 members. In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make votive objects (offerings) for sale

loans.name: Arlan

texts.en: Arlan, a 41-year-old married loving father of four children, is a responsible and patient person who grows corn and is requesting a loan of P27,000 to  purchase fertilizer, certified seeds, insecticides, and herbicides, and to pay the labor costs involved in transplanting corn crops for his corn field. Arlan would be thankful to Kiva lenders if they grant him his request, as he can think of no other source for the needed funds. With the help of the loan, Arlan could give his family a better future and educate all of his four children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, certified seeds, insecticides and herbicides and pay the labor costs involved in transplanting corn crops for his corn field

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Mr. Baasansuren, 52, has been working as a driver in a company for 10 years. He lives with his 2 children and his wife in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since his monthly salary usually does not meet his family's expenses, he always lends from people and financial institutions.

Recently Baasansuren built a new house on his small piece of land and could not finish the building completely. He especially needs to install a low-pressure furnace and panel-heating system, important factors to cut down his coal-fuel usage. It will also help the environment by decreasing the harmful effects from coal usage. The loan Baasansuren is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the new low-pressure furnace and panel-heating parts.

loans.use: To purchase a new low-pressure furnace and panel-heating parts to cut coal usage

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan is 28 years old and single. Since he was 16, he's been selling oil, tubes and other spare parts. He was only able to finish the 6th grade before he had to start working to earn an income. Two years ago he moved to Jakarta to open a workshop in hopes of growing his business. The business is going well and enables him to send money to his family in his home village outside of Jakarta.  

Evan will use part of this loan to buy more wheels/rims to sell to customers. He also will use some of the loan to buy medicine for his parents. This is his first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. His hope for his business is that someday he can have a large workshop with a complete set of tools. He enjoys the flexibility of running his own business and also has a couple of employees who help him.  

Evan hopes to get married and start a family. He wants to have enough money so that his children can get a better education than he was able to.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle wheels/rims to resell from his workshop

loans.name: Nerguibaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Nerguibaatar, 25, is an electrician in a private company. He lives with his family in the suburbs of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Nerguibaatar started working as an electrician 8 years ago, after graduating from high school. He has gained a lot of experience and is a skillful worker.

Nerguibaatar wants to renovate his old house which has never been repaired or renovated since being built. It has now become very old and cold to live in during the winter. Nerguibaatar has a plan to make internal adjustments and decorations in the house before next spring. Nerguibaatar is taking a loan to purchase some necessary building materials to renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Cengkeh Manis Group

texts.en:
Kartiyah is married with five children.  She is pictured in the photo wearing the white shirt with the butterfly on it.  She has been selling "nasi uduk" (an Indonesian rice dish) for seven years.  She sells it in front of her house to people in her neighborhood.  She enjoys the business because many children come to her stand to buy "nasi uduk" and she really loves children.  The business is going well and it helps supplement her husband's income as a driver to provide for her family.  She hopes that this first loan with VisionFund Indonesia will help her with her dream of growing her business by increasing the volume of food she can sell.  

The other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses which include selling toys at a local tourist attraction and selling vegetables.

loans.use: to pay for more rice, onions and coconut milk to make "nasi uduk" (an Indonesian rice dish) to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita, 45 years old, is married and has 3 children, the oldest 16 years old. Conchita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for 8 years. She sells canned goods, shampoo, and other items, earning PHP 3,000 per month. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks. Conchita hopes to have a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Rebie

texts.en:
Rebie is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and married, with three school-aged children.

Rebie has owned and operated a motorcycle transport business for over 10 years, earning approximately 1,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for maintenance and repairs for the motorcycle.

In 2010, Rebie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo has lived and worked on his farmland for almost 20 years. He is 52 years old, married and a responsible father to his four children. Romeo works in agriculture, particularly in growing corn. He is thankful because his wife helps him in this business and they work well together. According to Romeo, the farming business requires effort, dedication and strength to have a good harvest. Romeo is determined to raise his family's level of living and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates in order to get a better price when he sells his crops.

Romeo's income is not enough to buy farm supplies for his business. He would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to PHP 27,000 to buy farm supplies and to pay for labor to transplant his corn field. He hopes that he can get the amount requested to make his dreams come true and to give his children quality education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 10 лет. Он выращивает пшеницы, а потом продает за выгодную цену. Также он занимается скотоводством. Кроме этого он имеет дополнительный доход, который предоставляет услуги стройки домов. Дилмурод хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С прибылью он хочет ремонтировать свой дом. Дилмурод запрашивает займ для покупки семена и скота.
texts.en: Dilmurod is married and is a loving father of one child.  Dilmurod has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years.  He grows wheat and then sells it at a more profitable price.  He is also involved in animal husbandry.  Besides, he has an additional income from providing housing construction services.  Dilmurod wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  He then wants to use this profit to make repairs to his house.  Dilmurod is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Ella is married and has eight adult-aged children.

To make a living, Ella owns and operates a business in a food sector particularly in selling "suman"  in the local community. Ella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,100 PHP a month for these activities.

Ella is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients and other raw materials in making "suman". Suman is a Filipino rice cake steamed in banana leaves.

In 2011, Ella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to engage into  business.She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business and improve her business and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and other raw materials in making "suman"

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a married woman with six adult children. She is 51 years old and lives in Jimenes, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosalinda owns and operates a "sari-sari"(general store), selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP2,500.00. She has requested a loan of PHP10,000.00 to purchase products to resell. Rosalinda is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Rosalinda wants to build house and to finished her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell

loans.name: Concodia

texts.en: Concodia is from the village of Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old and married with seven adult children. To make a living, Concodia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities. Concodia is requesting a loan of 5,300 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In 2010, Concodia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as  manure.

In 2010, Vilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as  manure

loans.name: Pandan Wangi 2 Group

texts.en:
Sri is 41 years old and married with four children.  She has been selling clothes on credit around her neighborhood since 2007.  Her business is going well but she is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to increase the amount of clothing she can sell.  Her income allows her to help pay for food for her family.  

Sri hopes that in the future she can open a second business selling fried chicken.  She would also like to start to build a savings fund from her extra business income so that she will have money to send her children to college when they are old enough.

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to resell on credit.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Norma owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase pesticides for her vegetables. In 2010, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides for vegetables

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en: Enriquita is from the village of Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Enriquita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Enriquita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as  manure. In 2010, Enriquita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as  manure

loans.name: Rolev

texts.en:
Rolev is from the village of Mohon, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Rolev is married and has three adult aged children.

To make a living, Rolev owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products. Rolev has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rolev is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to resell.

In 2010, Rolev joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, in Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Jenelyn is married. Jenelyn operates a specialized retail store, selling sim packs and pre-paid cell phone credits. She earns 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to use to purchase additional cell phone products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jenelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

In 2008, Jenelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone products to sell

loans.name: Mutinda

texts.en: Mutinda is married and blessed with four children who are in school. For the last sixteen years, he has been running a retail shop and a grocery business to support his family. He also does farming to supplement his income. His potential customers are local residents. In the next 5 years, he wants to open another outlet of his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. Mutinda has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, rice, tomatoes, and fruits for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, tomatoes and fruits.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is married with one child. She lives in her own home with her family in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Jovelyn is operating a fishing business to make a living and has had this business for more than two years. Each month, she earns Php 1,500 doing this type of work. 

Jovelyn has seen her business grow and she wants to expand her business by buying more fish for her daily sales in the market. She has requested a loan Php 5,000 to purchase more fish to sell at the market.

Jovelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. In the future, with her income receipts, she will be able to pay for her family needs. Jovelyn is hard working and responsible for her business and her aim is to offer a better education to her only child with her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is from the village of Mitugas, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Trinidad is married and has four adult-aged children.

To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community. Trinidad sell it by door to door basis to her "suki" buyer. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Trinidad is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials in making "puto". Puto is the classic steamed Filipino rice cake shaped like an American muffin. Its texture is spongy and slightly fluffy. Puto is traditionally white, but can be colored pink, yellow, purple, even green.  There are many regional variations of puto. 
Recently Trinidad joined GDMPC to seek for financial Assistance as additional investment to her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and portion of it will be save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials in making "puto"

loans.name: Sait

texts.ru: Саит занимается агробизнесом более 6 лет и имеет хороший опыт. Он женат и у них трое детей. Он выращивает пшеницу и овощей на свою землю. Его жена помогает ему в бизнесе. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. Прибыль, который он получает, он ремонтирует свой дом.  Саит хотел бы получить займ для покупки семенное зерно и скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sait has been involved in an agricultural business for over six years and has a good experience in it.  He is married and has three children.  Sait grows wheat and vegetables on his land.  His wife helps him with the business.  Besides this, Sait is involved in animal husbandry.  He uses his profits to make repairs to his house.  Sait wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of sowing seeds and livestock in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and livestock

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a hardworking businesswoman aged 26. She is married and blessed with one child. For the last one year, she has been farming, growing fruits to support her family. She has employed two people to assist her in the business. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. Since Monicah joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito is 48 years old. Warlito is married and is a loving father of four children. He lives in Namnama village, in the Isabela area, with his wife, his children, his parents, and his brother. 

He is a responsible and goal-oriented person. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Warlito primarily grows corn. He wants to buy corn seeds and fertilizers to treat the land in order to get a good harvest. He also needs money to pay for his employees' work. This is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 25,000. Warlito thanks all creditors, who will support him.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer for his farm business

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is married with 3 children. Placida is 53 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Placida has a shop for air conditioning repair. She has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns approximately 10,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase equipment used for air conditioning repair for her business. Placida has been a member of PMPC since the beginning of 2011. In the future, Placida hopes to expand her shop.

loans.use: to purchase equipment used for air conditioning repair for her business

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Умарали женат и ответственный отец 4 детей. Более 33 лет он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. В основном он выращивает пшеницы, ячмень и арбуза. А также занимается животноводством. В бизнесе помогает ему жена, сын и невестка. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший прибыль и сыграть хатнатуй своего внука. Умарали запрашивает займ для покупки коров и овец, чтобы откармливать их, а потом продать и получить дополнительный доход.
texts.en: Umarali is married and is a responsible father of four children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 33 years.  He primarily grows wheat, barley and watermelons.  Umarali is also involved in animal husbandry.  His wife, son and daughter-in-law help him with the business.  Umarali wants to expand his business, make a good profit and hold a hatnatuy (circumcision) ceremony for his grandson.  Umarali is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle and sheep to fatten up, then sell them and earn an additional income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 40 years old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. He is married with two children. 
Ronald works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Ronald is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Ronald hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is dedicated to his agriculture business. He has been planting corn crops and has been in this line of business for five years. Aside from the farming business, his family also has a variety store where his wife is in charge of improving it. Mario has been characterized as a person who is hardworking and kind to his local community.

Mario said that the income he generates from his farming business goes immediately to cover their obligations to other traders where they get their farm supplies and some amount is used for their daily household expenses and payment for their electric bills monthly. He would like to improve his farm land so that his yield will increase but because his income is not enough, he is asking for additional capital in the amount of P27,000. This amount would be a big help in maintaining and improving his farming business. Mario is hoping that he could make his farm land more productive so that he could earn a greater income to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies needed in his agricultural business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a hardworking business man aged 28. He is married and blessed with one child who is in school. He has been supplying eggs to support his family. He also sells grocery to increase his income. In the next five years, he wants to succeed in his business. 

Since David joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy more trays of eggs, fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To buy trays of eggs, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Murodkhon

texts.ru: Муродхон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Муродхон занимается торговлей на рынке. Он продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения груши, винограда, огурцов, картошки, моркови и лука.
texts.en: Murodkhon lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 41 years old, married and has four children.  Murodkhon is involved in sales at a market.  He sells fruits and vegetables and has been involved in this business for 12 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of pears, grapes, cucumbers, potatoes, carrots and onions.

loans.use: to purchase pears, grapes, cucumbers, potatoes, carrots and onions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman with one infant child. Cheryl is 33 years old and resides at Pangabuan, Tangub City: Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been five years in this business. 

Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. Cheryl is been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Cheryl wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Она занимается купле – продажей тканей, женских платьев, мужских сорочек, постельное белье, мыло, порошок и т.д. Она открыла свой бизнес год назад и теперь хочет расширить его и пополнить оборотного капитала. Она хочет приобрести новый ассортимент товара. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 700$ USD. Она заранее благодарна вам всем за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Gulsara is a smart and hardworking woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of two children.  She is involved in buying and selling fabrics, women's dresses, men's shirts, bedding, soap, detergent, etc.  She opened her own business one year ago and now wants to expand it and increase her revolving capital.  Gulsara wants to purchase a new assortment of merchandise and is requesting a loan in the sum of $700 for this purpose.  She thanks all of you in advance for your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives with his family in the village where he produces income. He is a farmer who grows corn. He has been working his field for 13 years and through his harvest, he manages to provide food for their family’s needs.

He is 38 years old and is married with three school-aged children. His wife also sells vegetables in the local community for additional income. They are both thankful because, through their income from their businesses, they are able to send their children to school.
 
At this moment, Edwin is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm business. This loan will help him to improve his harvest so that he will have bigger income from his production that he sells in order to make income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a hardworking businesswoman aged 27. She is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling clothes for over two years to support her family. Joyce has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to the stock of clothes for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with the previous loan.

loans.use: To add to her clothes inventory.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 59-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells items like coffee, canned goods and detergent. Virginia also makes rice cakes and other local delicacies to sell to her community.

Virginia has requested a loan to buy flour, sticky rice, oil and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sticky rice, oil and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a farmer. He is married and he lives with his family. He has been growing corn for several years. He learned to do this from his father. This work makes Felix very happy. Due to his experience, he is able to do many farm processes perfectly.

Now he needs to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to start the process of planting corn. The purchase of these materials will be a great help for Felix. 

His dream is to one day have his own home and build a house.

loans.use: to buy seed to grow and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is an experienced entrepreneur and has been growing corn crops for 13 years. He is married to Margette who is a business-minded woman. Edgar is thankful because she helps him cultivate the farmland. She also works in their grocery store where she sells different kinds of groceries. Edgar sells his harvest at the local market.

He is requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP to expand his business. He will buy farm inputs to treat the land in order to generate more income for his family needs. Though he suffers hardships in maintaining his farming business, he does his best to make it more profitable. He hopes to improve his family's living conditions and to educate his children through the financial assistance he gets from all the KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to maintain farming business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a hardworking businesswoman, age 29 and married. For the last two years, she has been running a retail shop and a grocery business to make a living. Her potential customers are passersby and local residents. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Esther dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and fruits for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and fruits.

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru: Файзулло житель района Хамадони. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Файзулло уже 13 занимается торговлей. Он продает овощи и яблоки. Кредит берет для приобретения фруктов.
texts.en: Fayzullo is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  He is 44 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Fayzullo has been involved in sales for 13 years.  He sells vegetables and apples.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of fruits.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Avazkhon

texts.ru: Более 8 лет Авазхон занимается выращивание молодых деревьев. Он сам является владельцем данного бизнеса и имеет хорошую репутацию. В данный момент он имеет 5000 шт. саженцев абрикоса. Кроме этого он занимается скотоводством и имеет 2 голов овца. Осенью со своей семьей он занимается переработкой абрикоса, а потом продает зимою. Авазхон хотел бы получить займ для покупки горюче смазочных материалов.
texts.en: Avazkhon has been involved in growing tree seedlings for over 8 years.  He also owns this business and has a good reputation.  He currently has 5000 apricot seedlings.  Besides this, Avazkhon is involved in animal husbandry and has two heads of sheep.  Together with his family, he processes apricots in the autumn and sells them in the spring.  Avazkhon wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of fuel and lubricant materials.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in her community. She is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Edna is 57 years old, married and has five grown-up children. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 7 months and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Edna is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for additional investment to her existing business, to purchase grocery goods to sell. 

In 2011, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living conditions. She plans to use the revenue generated to used back to her business so that she will doubled the income by then.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and blessed with eight children. For the last five years, he has been practicing poultry farming to support his family. He also does dairy  and pig farming to supplement his income. He has employed one person to assist him to manage the business. 

In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business. Peter has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is 56 years old, and is married with three children. The source of income for his great family is the income received from the business of growing corn. He has been in this business for 15 years. He earned about 25,000 PHP with his last crop. He also buys and sells banana in the village where they are living. 

Now, Bonifacio wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his corn farm business. He hopes to increase his profits so that he can sustain the financial needs of the family, save money for the future, and to give daily allowances his youngest child who currently in school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his corn farm business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose, 36, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Romulo, 45, a private employee. She is a mother to three kids who are all attending school. She works hard as a mother and businesswoman to help her husband meet their daily needs and expenses

Rose owns a Loading Station store (pre-paid phone, internet, gaming etc.). She purchases loads from different networks and sells it in retail or as promoted by the network provider. Aside from this, she also buys and sells clothes and perfumes. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 550 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan amounting to Php18, 000 that will help to continue her business well. She will be utilizing the loan to buy adequate load, clothes and perfumes that will help her to meet the demands of her numerous customers. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to have more capital in her business, and at the same time sustain her children’s educational expenses.  

Rose dreams that her Loading Station and buy and sell business will continue to grow. She wants her children to finish studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it helps her to be stronger and read Bible regularly. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase products such as clothes, perfume and prepaid phone/internet loads for resale

loans.name: Analia Group

texts.en:
Analia is the leader in their group, living at New Village, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur and in good health. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business. Analia and her members have had their businesses for many years, and they requested a loan of 8000 each. Analia will purchase more stock for her general store.

Analia and her group members have been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose cooperative for almost one (1) year. In the future, Analia and her group members hope that they can earn more than they want, to support with financial assistance their family's living.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Kurbonbibi

texts.ru: Курбонбиби жительница Гиссарского района. Она разведена. Ей 35 лет. У нее трое детей. Курбонбиби занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном занимается торговлей фруктов. Этим видом  деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки овощей.
texts.en: Kurbonbibi is a resident of the Gissar district.  She is 35 years old, divorced and has three children.  Kurbonbibi is involved in sales at a market.  She primarily sells fruits.  She has been involved in this business for three years.  Kurbonbibi is requesting this loan for the purchase of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Kholik

texts.ru: Холик женат и имеет 3 детей. Его жена занимается купле – продажей сухофруктов и  обработкой косточек. Холик строитель национальных домов и более 8 лет занимается этим.  Холик запрашивает займ для штукатурки дома и устройство окон и дверей для двухкомнатного дома национального типа. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Kholik is married and has three children. His wife trades in dried fruits and processes fruit seeds and pits. Kholik builds traditional houses, and has been doing this type of work for more than eight years. Kholik is requesting a loan for plaster, and for installation of windows and doors in a two-room traditional home. He is thankful in advance for your help and support.

loans.use: to install doors and windows, and to purchase plaster

loans.name: Robert Michael

texts.en:
Robert Michael 28 years old and single. He is from Mabini Extention, Carmen annex Ozamiz city. To make a living, Robert Micheal owns and operates a  computer services business. His main source of income comes from his computer services. Robert Micheal has been in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 to 15,000 PHP a month.

Robert Micheal joined in GDMPC to gain financial services to help improve his living situation and have a successful business in computer services. Robert Micheal is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to support and improve his computer business. This will be first loan taken by Robert Micheal from GDMPC. He plans to also use his loan to improve his general living.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most impressive cooperative in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the province of Zamboanga del zur, Lanao del norte and Misamis occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of the farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*note: To maximize efficiency and reduce cost, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation of Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support and improve his computer service business.

location.town: Mabini Extention, Carmen annex Ozamiz city

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.
 
Edwin has a barber shop that provides hair cutting services. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for hair cutting.

Edwin has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Edwin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his barber shop

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Абдувохид женат имеет 4 детей. Он занимается купле - продажей легковых автомашин более 10 лет. Приобретает автомобиля из местных рынков, а потом ремонтирует его и продает за выгодную цену. Он сам является владельцем бизнеса и успешен в своем деле. Его супруга домохозяйка. Кроме этого он занимается купле – продажей автозапчастей б/у для автомашин. Абдувохид хотел бы получить займ для ремонта легкового автомобиля и пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Abduvohid is married and has four children.  He has been involved in buying and selling cars for over ten years.  He buys cars from local markets, repairs them and then sells them at more profitable prices.  Abduvohid is the owner of this business and is successful in his business.  His wife is a homemaker.  Besides this, he is also involved in buying and selling spare parts for cars.  Abduvohid wants to obtain this loan to repair a car and increase his revolving capital.

loans.use: to repair a car and increase his revolving capital

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Salvacion is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Salvacion owns and operates a net-working business venture, selling cosmetics in the local community. 

Salvacion has been engaged in her business for over 7 months and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities. Salvacion is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the expansion of her business. 

In 2010, Salvacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in the expansion of her business

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
Africana is married with 4 children. She is 43 years old and 2 of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Africana has a food production business in the Philippines. Africana requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Africana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 25 years old and lives in Luyang, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two children.

Geraldine is engaged in the selling of cosmetic products to her regular customers, and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 to purchase more cosmetics products.

Geraldine has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for six months. In the future, Geraldine hopes to expand her business and have saved deposits for her children`s future education.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to sell

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Fedila works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vulcanizing. Fedila is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Fedila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Geraldine requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Luzonia

texts.en:
Luzonia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Luzonia has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Luzonia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luzonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lilibeth is 42 years old and is married with 5 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has had a rope making business in the Philippines for 8 years. She is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her rope making business.

Ma. Lilibeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope making business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari sari store in the Philippines. She also earns money from food vending.  She has been in business for 10 years.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari sari store.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en:
Ammie is 32 years old, is married, and has 1 child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has been in business for 3 years. Ammie sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Ammie is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy items like slippers, towels, and other clothing to sell.

Ammie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like slippers, towels and other clothing to sell.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
This is Redentor, 37, a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is a widowed father of one child who is now studying in high school. By the grace of God, Redentor has managed to support his child’s schooling. He is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Redentor operates a tricycle transportation business. He has one tricycle (motorcycle with side car) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. His regular customers are his neighbors and members of the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 300 everyday.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle and for the tricycle registration renewal. He expects a boost in income as he expands his business. 

Redentor dreams of sending his child to college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the bible he studies.* 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To maintain his tricycle and renew its registration for his business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married with ten children. She is 57 years old and lives in Timan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Rosalinda sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3500 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 2000 PHP to purchase charcoal to sell.

Rosalinda has been a member of PMPC more than one year. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jocy

texts.en:
Jocy is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. For eight years, Jocy has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocy has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jocy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Deoagracia

texts.en: Deoagracia, a 57-year-old widowed mother of six, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food production business in the Philippines for five years. Deoagracia has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, a hardworking entrepreneur, has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past two years. She also earns income from E-loading.

Evelyn, who has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans NWTF, is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her store. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
ESTRELITA
At the age of 17, Estrelita got married. She is now 48 years of age and has six children going to school. Estrelita engages in a retailing business in their village. She sells snack foods, beverages and spices. Estrelita’s husband is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines.
With her dreams to improve their living, Estrelita engaged herself in a hog-raising business. She started this business only when her family experienced financial difficulties. Now, Estrelita has been in this business for almost 21 years. She said that she could not have reached this length of managing her hog-raising business if she didn’t love what she was doing.
Estrelita’s profit from the retailing business went toward her family's daily needs and some for the feed of her hogs. Still, her profit was not enough to sustain the feed of her hogs. Estrelita decided to take out a loan of P15,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a humble agriculturist and hard-working father. He is a widower and lives with his only child. His hopes to improve their living conditions and support his only child's education.

Robert has been planting corn for almost 15 years. According to him, the greatest challenge he faces today is that he doesn't have the financial resources to purchase farm supplies. He is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000. Robert said this would help him maintain and improve the farmland he cultivates. He believes and hopes that he can overcome all his hardships in life and that his child can earn a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his corn farming business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has a shop that sells plastic ware, clothing and beauty products from Avon and Tupperware. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Evelyn has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock from Avon and Tupperware to sell.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Avon and Tupperware to sell

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 41 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, a farmer, and is a mother to their three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Bella makes a living by farming. She, together with her husband, plants seasonal crops of fruits and vegetables. Her products are pineapple and papaya. She’s been in this business for twenty-five years. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She makes a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of Php10, 000. She will be using the money to buy materials and inputs needed for farming such as fertilizers and seedlings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Bella hopes her business will continue to succeed in the coming years. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farming materials and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en: Eleuteria works hard to support her family. She is single and has a piggery business in the Philippines. Eleuteria requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Eleuteria has been in her business for five years. In the future, Eleuteria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Arlene has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a flexible and diligent mother of four. Aside from her hog-raising business that allows her to earn a profit every six months, she also sells processed meat products for daily income. She offers longganisa and tocino (cured and pork sausages) and hot dogs in her neighborhood. She had established this business five years ago and earns a profit just enough for the daily allowances of her children. Myrna is 45 years old and married. She wants to seek a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy more longganisa, tocino, hot dogs and fish balls to sell in her neighborhood. She wants to earn consistent profits to save for the future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy more longganisa and tocino (types of sausages), hot dogs and fish balls to sell in her neighborhood.
