Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Ludmila is from a small town called Veseloe. She is a widow, and has single-handedly raised two sons, Andrei and Pavel. Ludmila has a small shop called Temp, located in the town's central market. She sells car parts and stationary goods, and provides photography and photocopying services. Ludmila started her business back in 2003. Since then her working capital has grown to 21,000 UAH and her profit is 7,000 UAH. Ludmila hopes to invest her Kiva loan of 10,000 UAH into purchase of inventory and a new photo printer. She is enjoying this direction of her business, and is confident that it is the most suitable for herself and her town. With the additional profits from her business, Ludmila plans to renovate her home, which has been in need of attention for quite some time.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and acquire a new photo printer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a hardworking businesswoman aged 40. She is married and blessed with four children,  three of whom are in school. She has been running a beauty salon to support her family. Previously, she was runnng a welding business. Florence has employed two people to assist her to manage the business. She describes her business as good since her potential customers are local residents. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hairdrier machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hairdrier machine and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is married and blessed with two children who are in school. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been running a retail shop to support his family. He also operates a greengrocer business to supplement his income. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, tomatoes and onions for resale. In the next five years, he plans to open another outlet of his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга живет в небольшом селе Веселое вместе со своим мужем и двумя взрослыми дочерьми. Она реализует женскую одежду на местном центральном рынке. Ольга всегда предлагает широкий выбор одежды по приемлемым ценам. Рыночной торговлей она занимается вот уже 13 лет. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 30 000 гривен, прибыль – 8 000 гривен. 

Ольга планирует использовать кредит КИВА в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женскую одежду к осенне-зимнему сезону. Благодаря расширению ассортимента Ольга надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и за счет этого улучшать благосостояние своей семьи. Ольге очень нравится работать с этой группой товаров и развивать свой бизнес. Она надеется и дальше двигаться вперед и преуспевать в своем деле. 
Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Olga lives in a small town called Veseloe, with her husband and two grown-up daughters. She sells women's clothing at the local central market. Olga has a wide assortment of clothing which she sells at accessible prices. She has worked as a retailer at the market for 13 years. Today, her working capital is 30,000 UAH and her profit is 8,000 UAH. Olga plans to use a Kiva loan in the amount of 10,000 UAH to purchase women's clothing for fall and winter. With an even wider selection of clothing, Olga hopes to increase her profits and thus improve her family's standard of living. Olga really enjoys working with women's clothing and developing her business. She hopes to keep moving forward and succeeding in her business.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing for fall and winter.

loans.name: Kos Wende Group

texts.fr:
Mme S.MARIE  est la représentante du groupe KOSWENDE .Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments, des céréales et du bois de chauffe  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de toécé village environnant. Ses clients sont les femmes du quartier.

Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de choux, 03 tines de haricots et une charrette de bois de chauffe.

Mme utilise ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  acheter une bouteille à gaz et aider son mari dans les charges familliales.
texts.en:
Mrs. S.Marie is the representative for the group Koswende. She is married and has two children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is 14. One is attending school. She has five people under her care.

She has been selling condiments, cereals, and firewood for five years. She buys her supplies at the nearby Toécé large market in a nearby village. Her clients are composed of women from the neighborhood.

She wants to buy one sack of cabbage, three tins of beans, and a cart of firewood.

She is using the profits to increase the size of her business and improve her family's living conditions. She hopes to buy a gas cylinder and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy one sack of cabbage, three tins of beans, and one cart of firewood.

loans.name: Twongerumusaruro / Bgrm Group

texts.fr:
Zachée fait partie du groupe Twongerumusaruro/Bgrm. Le nom du groupe signifie «augmentons la production». Il a 52 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 8 à 22 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Zachée est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées du riz et agrandir la surface de culture du riz en achetant d’autres champs. Avec les profits, Zachée prévoit de soigner et scolarises ses enfants.
texts.en:
Zachée is a member of the Twongerumusaruro/Bgrm group, which means "increasing production". He is 52 years old, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 8 and 22 years old. 6 of these children attend school, and Zachée attended 6 years of school, until the end of primary school.

Zachée is a rice farmer. This is the second loan he is asking for from ACB, and will use it to purchase chemical fertilizers that can aid him in growing rice. In order to grow his business he plans to use selected rice grains and purchase more fields. Zachée hopes to use these profits to provide for the education and health of his children.

loans.use: purchase chemical fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: Khakakho Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khakakho SHG Group in Western Kenya! Robert is the facilitator of the Khakakho SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Robert takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Robert had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Robert was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robert and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Robert will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khakakho SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a business-lady who runs a beauty salon.  Her husband runs a taxi business.  She used her previous loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair dryer.  Since then, she has been able to provide her services more efficiently. She has also added one employee to assist her in her business.

Damaris has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair blow dryer and chairs.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dryer and chairs

loans.name: Israyil

texts.en: Israyil is a 23-year-old sheep breeder. He raises sheep and sells them for meat and fur purposes. Additionally, he has a cow that he uses for milk and milk products. His monthly income is 120 AZN. Israyil has three years of experience in this field. His father helps him run the business and he was the person who gave him the best experience and skills to look after animals. Now Israyil applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN to purchase one milkier cow and several sheep.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and eight sheep

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
It's two years since Everlyne started a business selling spare parts. Her business grew since she borrowed a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings, which she used to buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid.  She also testifies that her clientele has grown.

Everlyne needs another loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy engine oil, brake fluid, brake pads and battery acid.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, brake fluid, brake pads and battery acid

loans.name: Gullubeyim

texts.en: Gullubeyim is 55 and married with three children. She sells milk and dairy products to the local farmers and she has been doing that for the last eight years. The income her business generates is 300 AZN. Her husband helps her to look after the cows.  She applied for 1,000 AZN loan to purchase an additional milkier cow and cattle.

loans.use: to purchase one dairy cow and one cattle

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is 25, is married, and has two sons. He sells home products in the central market of his home city, Sabirabad. Arzu has five years of experience in this field. His father helps him and now it is a family business. Arzu applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to purchase more products and satisfy the customers' demands. This will be his second loan and he has a good history as a client.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to increase stock

loans.name: Elyas

texts.en: Elyas is a 50-year-old farmer who raises and sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. He sells crops in the local bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN, and this is the sole financial income for his family. Elyas has 10 years of experience in farming. Now he thinks it is time to grow and he would like to get ahead in satisfying customers' demands. He would like to purchase more seeds and organic fertilizers in order to have more crops for next spring. For this purpose, he applied for an 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan is a successful businessman with a good history as a client. He was able to grow his business from small to large. Now, he is selling detergents and other home washing items. He is married and has four children. Khasan has six years of experience in trading. This business brings him a stable income and his monthly profit is 300 AZN. He would like to expand his business. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. This will be his fourth loan from AqroInvest and he promises to pay back on time.

loans.use: to purchase more items in order to increase profits

loans.name: Philip B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  This school, established in 1976, is staffed with 19 employees and has about 400 pupils. The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish merely with their salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in businesses. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on the teachers' behalf.

Fifty-eight-year-old Philip is the leader of this group of teachers.  He was born in Koinadugu, in northern Sierra Leone. Philip is married and has eight children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Philip has served in the teaching profession for 38 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials (cement, rods, and galvanized corrugated iron) for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, and galvanized corrugated iron for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Abajyamugambi N05/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Augustin fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi N05/RSZ. Il a 45 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 5 à 21 ans, dont 6 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Augustin est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Augustin voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, Augustin prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Augustin is a member of the Abajyamugambi N05/RSZ group.  He is 45 years old, married and has six children between the ages of 5 and 21, all of whom attend school.  He attended school through the sixth year of primary school. 

Augustin is a rice grower.  This is his first loan with ACB.  He is going to use his credit to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice operation.

His strategy for growing his business is to use only select rice seed.  In the next few years, Augustin would like to expand his rice growing terrain.  With his profits, Augustin foresees being able to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for his rice growing operation.

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad is 62. He runs a pharmacy in a bazaar in his town. He has five years of experience in this field. Farkhad is married and has four children. One of his sons helps him to run the business.  His monthly income is 300 AZN. This is the sole financial income for his family.  Selling pharmaceuticals is one of the most popular businesses and Farkhad would like to expand it. He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to purchase more children's pharmaceuticals, which are in very high demand among his regular customers.

loans.use: to purchase more children's pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anash

texts.en:
Anash is a 42-year-old woman who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. She's dedicated mostly to raising pomegranates, as this is the most popular fruit in Azerbaijan.  

Anash's income is 100 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). Her father is helping her. Anash applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to purchase seeds, working tools and fertilizers. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, working tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy winter clothes from a neighbor country for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to cover market demand.

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif is 52-year-old man who's engaged in raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has done this for the last 10 years. He usually sells his crops in the local central bazaar. 

Vagif is married and has five children. Together with his wife, Vagif was able to increase his profit and gain respect among his customers. Now he applied for 1,000 Azerbaijani New Mant (AZN) loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jamilya

texts.en: Jamilya is a 51-year-old woman who sells food products. She has six years of experience in this field. Jamilya runs her business together with her husband. She has three daughters. Her current income from the business is 300 Azerbaijani Manats (AZN). Jamilya applied for a loan of 1300 AZN to purchase more products and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: purchase more products to increase profit

loans.name: Peter Morlai's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  This school, established in 1978, is staffed with six teachers and has about 200 pupils. The staff of this institution, like many other schools’ staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise be unable to accomplish with their mere salaries. Some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, land or house-building materials; others invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-six-year-old Peter is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Makeni. Peter is married and has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Peter has served in the teaching profession for 34 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has ten children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Harriet has a tailoring business  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. Harriet sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through pay phone and rental rooms.

Harriet has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials and a deep freezer. The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and to build more rental rooms. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials and a deep freezer

loans.name: Ehritam

texts.en: Ehritam is a 51-year-old farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last ten years. He is married and has three children. His wife helps Ehtiram to run the business. He usually sells his crops in the central bazaar. His business generates 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) profit per month.  He would like to expand his business and for this purpose he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. This will be the second loan from AqroInvest and he has a good client history.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Babak

texts.en: Babak is a 46-year-old trader who sells beverages and food. He has five years of experience in this field. Babak is very polite and friendly and his attitude to customers makes his business very successful. His monthly income from his business is 300 Azerbaijani manats (AZN). He is married and has four children. He wishes to increase his income which will allow him to improve life conditions of his family. For this purpose he applied for a loan for 1700 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase and diversify goods in his shop. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase more goods for his shop.

loans.name: Jamala

texts.en: Jamala is a 57-year-old vendor who sells food and home products. She has 5 years of experience in this field. Her monthly income is approximately 300 AZN. She is a successful entrepreneur because the location of her shop is in the central market. Jamala is married and has two children. She applied for 1,000 AZN in order to purchase more goods and cover customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to cover customer demand.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif is a 55-year-old man who is making keys. He has 20 years of experience. He is married and has four children. Akif has a small shop where he makes keys and locks, which are handmade and very popular among local people. His monthly income is about 200 AZN. His son works with him. He applied for 1,200 AZN in order to improve working conditions and purchase material to make keys. Akif has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase material and improve work conditions.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 50-year-old man who sells milk and breeds cattle. He has 6 years of experience in this field. Iman`s profit from milk sales is about 200 AZN and 100 AZN from cattle sales. Iman applied for 1,500 AZN in order to purchase more cattle and a milk cow. As milk and meat products are most popular, the demand on them is high, and Iman is not able to cover it anymore.  Thus he needs additional finances to purchase more cattle, produce more milk and meat and increase his profit. This will be his 5th loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase one milk cow and two cattle.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Jessica has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells items such as sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Jessica to generate greater profits and open up another shop that sells clothes. Jessica hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Jessica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jessica who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Olivia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells items like sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Olivia to generate greater profits and to relocate her business to another place. Olivia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy clothes for resale. 

Olivia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Olivia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 36 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, May has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells items like books and pens. 

To help expand her business, May has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books for resale, and will help May to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. May hopes that in the future she will be able to own two other shops of the same business. 

May is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like May who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more books for resale,

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 33 years old and lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has two sons. For several years Sargis worked as a crane driver, after which he worked as head of security at one of the Ijevan companies. 

Since 1993, Sargis and his mother have established their own business, which is fruit and vegetable trading at the Ijevan food market. Sargis buys fruits and vegetables from the neighboring villages and resells them in Ijevan city. Thanks to profit from his business, Sargis has built a shop for his trading and has bought new furniture for their apartment. 

This is his second loan from Kiva and he is looking forward to continuing the growth of his business. Sargis is seeking a loan of 550,000 Armenian drams to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Concepcion Magdalena

texts.es: Concepción, nuevamente se decidió a tener un nuevo  crédito, por la buena atención D. nuestra institución porque quiere seguir aumentando en su negocio y comprar más ropa para damas y caballeros como: bóxer, camisas, pantalones, faldas, el propósito  D. ella es ofrecerles a sus clientes variedad. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho a incrementar en sus ventas  y  ayudar a  su familia a salir adelante con los gastos D. la casa.
texts.en: Concepción decided once again to have a new loan because of the good service she received from our institution.  She wants to continue increasing her business and to buy more clothes for woman and men like boxer shorts, shirts, pants and skirts.  Her goal is to offer her customers variety.  The previous loans helped her much to increase sales and help her family get ahead with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Victoriano Candelario

texts.es: Victoriano, nuevamente se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere cultivar la tierra y sembrar maíz y frijol, por eso comprara fertilizantes como: abono, semilla, herbicidas, con el propósito de que este año sean mejores las cosechas .los financiamientos anteriores le ayudo a tener  una buena cosecha de frijol que le dio mucha ganancia, esto le ayudo a mejorar los problemas económicos que tenía y ha ayudado  a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en: Victoriano decided to have another loan again because he wants to till the land and plant corn and beans.  He will buy fertilizer, manure, seeds and herbicide so that his crops will be better this year.   Previous loans helped him have a good bean harvest that produced high profits.  This helped him to improve the economic problems he had and has helped his family with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Melva Albertina

texts.es: Melva, nuevamente necesita  otro crédito, porque quiere seguir aumentando  en sus ingresos y por ese motivo comprara más maíz, leña, el propósito D. ella es tener lo suficiente para atender a los clientes y seguir mejorando su negocio. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a aumentar en sus ventas y los ingresos esto le permitió tener una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.
texts.en: Melva needs another loan again because she wants to continue increasing her income, so she will buy more corn and firewood.  Her goal is to have enough to take care of the customers and continue improving her business.  The previous loans helped her to increase her sales and income.  This allowed her to have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 35 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Steven has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells motor spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Steven has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for resale, and will help Steven to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Steven hopes that in the future he will be able to build a shop that will eliminate the cost of renting. 

Steven is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Steven who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba, D. nuevo se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere aumentar en sus ingresos y por eso comprara más maíz por mayor ya que luego subirán los precios, el propósito D. ella es tener lo suficiente para atender a los clientes con su venta D. tortillas y mejorar su negocio. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron a aumentar en sus ventas, ya que tenia disponible la materia prima, esto le permitió tener una mejor calidad D. vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Alba decided again to have another loan because she wants to increase her income, so she will buy more corn wholesale since later the prices will go up.  Her goal is to have enough to take care of her customers and improve her business.  The previous loans helped her to increase her sales, since she had the ingredients on hand.  This allowed her to have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her grocery store. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for resale, and will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to own a large shop. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 46 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Nuru has been working hard to manage her boutique shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Nuru has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Nuru to generate greater profits and expand her business. Nuru hopes that in the future she will be able to own another business. 

Nuru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nuru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Prossy has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for seven years and works six days a week, selling her products at the market.

Prossy has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more used clothes for resale. Her main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing used clothes and to own a delivery van.

Prossy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Adalberto Enrique

texts.es: Adalberto, debido a la necesidad en aumentar en sus ventas se ha decidido a tener otro crédito, para mejorar su negocio y comprar más medicina como: jarabe para la tos, pastillas, el objetivo de él es tener más variedad de productos para los clientes y aumentar más en sus ventas. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho aumentando en sus ventas, esto le permitió mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.Lastimosamente se atraso con un mes, pagando tarde y con un porcentaje de mora.
texts.en:
Adalberto has decided to have another loan because he needs to increase his sales to improve his business and buy more medicines such as cough syrup and pills.

His goal is to have a greater variety of products for his customers and increase his sales more.  The previous loans helped him a lot to increase his sales, which allowed him to improve his family's living conditions.  Unfortunately he got behind by one month, paying late and with a late fee.

loans.use: to buy cough syrup and pills to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul, 35, lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Abdul has been working hard to manage his retail shop, selling items like sugar and soap.

To help expand his business, Abdul has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale and will help Abdul to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Abdul hopes that in the future he will be able to own a house. 

Abdul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abdul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam, 36, lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Sam has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts for resale and will help Sam to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Sam hopes that in the future he will be able to further expand his business.

Sam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Guadalupe De Jesus

texts.es:
Guadalupe, vive con su familia, una hija y su esposo, Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de comida, trabaja todos los días de la semana ofreciendo comida a los vecinos y lugares cercanos, ya tiene experiencia en el negocio y lo hace para obtener ingresos que ayuden a solventar gastos en su hogar.
Ella comprara una mesa térmica, para esto solicita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto, y de las ganancias que produzcan las ventas, pagara las cuotas, ya que esta inversión es muy necesaria para mejorar la vistosidad del comedor, mejorando su imagen ante los clientes.
La aspiración de Guadalupe es que a través de los préstamos pueda crecer en el negocio, y comprarse su propia casa.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives with her family, her daughter and her husband.  Guadalupe works selling food.  She works ever day of the week providing meals to her neighbors and people from nearby locations.  She has experience in this business, and works to obtain income to help cover her household expenses.

She will be buying a heated serving table, so she is requesting a loan to cover the cost.  She will make her repayments from the earnings that she will generate with her sales, and this investment is highly necessary to improve the way her diner looks, improving her image with her customers.

Guadalupe's aspiration is that through loans, she will be able to grow her business and purchase her own home.

loans.use: to buy a heated serving table to keep her food hot.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 17, 10 y 8 años de edad, ella aprendió el negocio de la elaboración de tortillas por su familia, ya que necesitaba tener un ingreso para poder colaborar con el esposo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales, pues está construyendo un ranchito donde venderá las tortillas, ella necesita laminas, madera, teja, para poder instalarse en un lugar donde los clientes fácilmente puedan comprarle las tortillas.
Su aspiración es que el negocio mejore, ser buen cliente con pagos frecuentes y sobre todo mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Maribel works selling tortillas.  She lives with her husband and three children who are 17, 10 and 8 years old.  She learned the tortilla making business from her family since she needed to earn income to help collaborate with her husband.

She’s asking for a loan to buy building materials because she’s building a small stall to sell her tortillas in; she needs metal sheets, lumber and roofing tiles to install herself in a place where customers can easily buy tortillas from her.

Her goal is that the business improves, to be a good client making frequent payments and, above all, to improve her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, lumber and roofing tiles.

loans.name: Paulino Antonio

texts.es:
Paulino, tiene 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres, está soltero, él atiende un taller de reparación de vehículos, lleva 3 años en este taller, lo aprendió siendo ayudante en otros talleres, atiende de lunes a sábado.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para reparar el sistema eléctrico de su propio vehículo, reinstalara todo el sistema, ya que últimamente el vehículo presenta muchos problemas, este préstamo le ayudara para solventar esta situación.
La aspiración de Paulino es mejorar el taller, capacitándose para resolver los problemas mecánicos de la mejor manera, sirviendo con más eficiencia a los clientes.
texts.en:
Paulino, 21, lives with his parents; he’s single.  He has had a vehicle repair shop for three years.  He learned working as an assistant in other shops.  He’s open Monday through Saturday.

He’s asking for a loan to buy spare parts to repair the electrical system in his own car.  He will reinstall the entire system because the car has been having many problems recently; this loan will help him overcome this situation.

Paulino’s goal is to improve the shop to train so that he can solve mechanical problems the best way possible thus serving customers more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, rice, chicken, meat, condimetns and beverages.

loans.name: Twisungane Rgt Group

texts.fr:
Fabien fait partie du groupe Twisungane Rgt. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec un enfant de 9 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Fabien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Fabien voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, Fabien prévoit de soigner son enfant.
texts.en:
Fabien belongs to the group Twisungane Rgt. He is 28 years old and married, and he has a 9-month-old child. Fabien has a 6th grade education. He is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the micro-finance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers for rice farming. 

His strategy for business growth is to use select rice seeds. In the next few years, he would like to expand his rice fields. With the profits, Fabien plans on taking care of his child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Paz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Paz, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, todos trabajan en el hogar y ayudan para cubrir las necesidades, Paz administra una tienda de productos domésticos,  inicio por el apoyo de su esposo, lo tiene en su propia casa, lo atiende durante el día.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería  como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, detergentes, esta compra le ayudara para crecer en el inventario y le dé más oportunidades para aumentar las ventas. 
La aspiración de Paz, es que su negocio crezca, que cuente con mucha clientela, manejar bien este préstamo y poder mejora también los ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Paz lives with her family, her husband and two children; they all work at home and help to meet needs.  Paz runs a grocery store that she started with help from her husband.  It’s home-based and she tends to it all day.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, beans, oil, snacks and detergent.  This purchase will help her inventory grow and will give her more opportunities to increase sales.

Paz’s hope is that the business grows, that she has much more clientele, to manage the loan well and to be able to also improve family income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
el socio Fredy, tiene 40 años,es casado y tiene 2 hijos,el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de artesania,el socio vende tejidos y productos de artesania entre mantas y tejidos,el socio tiene una tienda en el dsitrito de Chinchero,el socio trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.El socio solicita el prestramo para comprar artesania ocmo mantas,tejidos y aretes al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Fredy, 40, is married and has two children.  He continues selling crafts.  He sells textiles and crafts like blankets and woven items.  He has a store in Chinchero District.   He works from 6am until 5pm and supports his children through this business.  He wants to expand and improve the crafts selling business and is asking for a loan to buy crafts like blankets, textiles and earrings at wholesale.  He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts like blankets, textiles and earrings at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, este surgió por la necesidad de tener ingresos, trabajando todos los días para atender la clientela.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la compra de 4 quintales de maíz, este préstamo le ayudara para tener suficiente materia prima para preparar la venta.
El objetivo de María, es abrir las puertas con los préstamos, para crecer con el negocio y poder mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: María sells tortillas.  She lives with her husband.  She’s been in this business for a long time.  It arose from her need to ear income.  She works taking care of customers every day. She’s asking for a loan at present to buy 4 quintals of corn.  This loan will help her have enough raw materials on hand for sales. María’s hope is to open doors with the loan to grow in business and improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy 4 quintals of corn.

loans.name: Mauricio Armando

texts.es: Mauricio, nuevamente necesita otro crédito, porque quiere mejorar su negocio y por eso necesita comprar materiales para la elaboración de pan francés como: un cilindro para hacer francés, harina, azúcar y gas, el objetivo de él es tener lo suficiente material y herramientas para mejorar la produccion y para atender la demanda de clientes que tiene, los créditos anteriores le ayudaron a crecer en sus ganancias, esto le ayudo a mejorar lo económico en su familia mejorando las condiciones que antes tenían.
texts.en: Mauricio once again needs another loan because he wants to improve his business and needs to buy supplies to make French bread like a cylinder to make French baguettes, flour, sugar and gas.  His goal is to have sufficient ingredients and equipment to improve production and meet the demand he has.  Previous loans helped him to increase profits which helped him improve his family economically improving the conditions they used to have.

loans.use: to buy a cylinder to make French baguettes, flour, sugar and gas.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth pertenece al banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Elizabeth tiene 24 años de edad y es soltera pues aun no tiene hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Elizabeth  trabaja en la municipalidad del Manu en el área de gerencia como asistenta de gerencia. Ya son varios años que se dedica a trabajar y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Elizabeth requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa. El sueño de la Elizabeth es abrir una agencia de viajes. 

Elizabeth agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Elizabeth belongs to the “Del Futuro del Manu” communal bank.  The communal bank’s members meet every thirty days in the city of Salvación in Manu Province and Madre de Dios Department.

Elizabeth is 24 years old, single and does not have children yet.  She was born in the city of Salvación and lives still in the same city she was born in and where she carries out her economic activities.  Elizabeth works for the city of Manu as an assistant in the management office.  She’s been working for several years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Elizabeth needs the loan to do some home improvements.  Elizabeth’s dream is to open a travel agency.  Elizabeth appreciates and values the loan and commits to meet her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Yancy Magali

texts.es: Yancy, por la buena atención de nuestra institución se ha decidido a tener otro crédito, porque quiere mejorar en su inventario y por eso comprara más: faldas, blusas, camisas, pantalones, el objetivo de ella es ofrecerles a sus clientes más variedad y comprar una plancha para vender pupusas por las tardes y de esa forma aumentar en sus ingresos. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho a crecer en su negocio a tener mejores ingresos y a tener más clientela, este avance le ayudado a salir adelante con algunas necesidades de su familia y ahora viven en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Because of the good service she’s gotten from our institution, Yancy has decided to have another loan because she wants to improve her inventory so will buy more: skirts, blouses, shirts and pants.  Her goal is to offer more variety to her customers and to buy griddle to sell pupusas [stuffed griddle corn cakes] in the evening to increase her income.

Previous loans helped her very much to grow in business and earn higher income and to have more customers.  This loan has also helped her meet some family needs and so they now live in better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Patricia Evelyn

texts.es: Patricia, nuevamente está solicitando un nuevo crédito, porque necesita invertir  más  y mejorar en su negocio de productos esotéricos  como: talismanes, velas, lociones, esencias, el propósito de ella es ofrecerles a los clientes más variedad y buen producto. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a fortalecer más su negocio, este avance le permitió mejorar económicamente y siempre mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en: Patricia is requesting a new loan because she wants to invest again in her business, and improve it with arcane products such as: talismans, candles, lotions and essences.  Her goal is to be able to offer her customers a variety of good products.  Her previous loans helped her to strengthen her business.  This advance will allow her to have a better economic situation and keep her business stable.

loans.use: to buy talismans, candles, lotions and essences

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Felipa; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella vende tejidos y tambien vende chompas,pantalones y polos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella vende en el distrito de Chinchero,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tejidos y mantas,la socia quierea ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tejidos y mantas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los tejidos como lana,tintes y palitos de tejer y tambien para comprar chompas,polos y sombreros al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Felipa is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She is continuing to work in her handicraft business.  She sells knitted items and also sweaters, pants and polo shirts.  Felipa works from 8am until 6pm, and she sells in the Chinchero district.  She wants to expand and improve her business selling knitted items and blankets. Felipa requests a loan to buy materials to make knitted items such as wool, dyes and knitting needles.  With the loan she will also buy sweaters, polo shirts and hats at wholesale.

Felipa is pleased to have this loan and she pledges to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy knitting materials such as wool, dyes and knitting needles, and also to buy sweaters, polo shirts and hats at wholesale

loans.name: Joel Manaen

texts.es:
Joel, nuevamente necesita otro préstamo, debido a la necesidad de comprar más herramientas para su taller como: llaves, una pulidora, con el propósito de tener lo necesario para facilitarle  el trabajo y tener más clientes. El préstamo anterior le ayudo a comprar más herramientas y eso le ha facilitado a mejorar su trabajo y por consiguiente le ayudara a su familia en los gastos de la casa.
Joel presento unos atrasos en el prestamo anterior, cuando logro cancelar totalmente se le dio la oportunidad del nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en: Joel once again needs another loan because of the need to buy more tools for his shop like wrenches and a polisher so that he’ll have everything he needs to facilitate his work and have more customers.  The previous loan helped him buy more tools and this has made it easier for him to improve his business and as a result will help his family with household expenses.  Joel had some delays with previous payments but when he managed to completely repay the loan he was given the opportunity of a new one.

loans.use: to buy wrenches and a polisher.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Adolfo; el tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,el socio vende chompas,mantas,chalinas y gunates,el socio vende en el centro artesanal del distrito de Chinchero,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania . El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas,chalinas,guantes y sombreros al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Adolfo, 25, is the member; he’s 25 years old and single.  He continues selling crafts.  He sells sweaters, blankets, shawls and gloves.  He sells in Chinchero’s crafts district and works from 8am until 6pm.  He supports his children through this business.  He wants to enlarge and improve the crafts sales business and is asking for a loan to buy more crafts like sweaters, shawls, gloves and hats at wholesale.  He’s happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, meat, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es: Vilma, se ha decidido a obtener otro crédito, debido a la necesidad de aumentar en sus ventas y porque se acercan las fiestas patronales y comprara: pollo, carne, chicharrón, verduras, el propósito de ella es vender más por las fiestas y obtener mejores  ingresos. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron mucho pues ahora tiene mejores ingresos y su familia vive en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en: Vilma has decided to obtain another loan because she needs to increase sales and because the local patron saint day festivities are approaching.  She will buy chicken, meat, fried pork, vegetables.  Her intention is to sell more because of the festivities and earn higher income.  The previous loans helped her much because now she has improved income and her family lives in better conditions than before.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and fried pork.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Fernando; el tiene 41 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,el tiene un taller donde tienen maquinas de tejer y realiza trabajos de artesania como chompas,chalinas y gunates y luego los vende en el distrito de Chinchero,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas,chalinas y guantes al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Fernando, 41, is married and has two children.  He continues selling crafts.  He has a shop where he has looms and crafts like sweaters, shawls and gloves are made that he then sells in Chinchero district.  He works from 8am until 6pm and supports his children with this work.  He wants to expand and improve the crafts selling business and is asking for a loan to buy crafts like sweaters, shawls and gloves at wholesale.  He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy crafts at wholesale.

loans.name: William Heriberto

texts.es:
William, necesita otro crédito nuevamente, porque lo invertirá en gastos de educación de una sobrina, el objetivo de él es que su sobrina salga a delante con sus estudios y que en el futuro sea profesional. El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho solventar los gastos de estudio y de esa forma tiene los recursos para ayudarles a su familia en lo que necesitan.
Este nuevo prestamo es para pagar las ultimas colegiaturas de la secundaria, de su sobrina.
texts.en: William needs another loan again because he’ll use it to pay educational costs for a niece.  His goal is that she gets ahead with her studies and becomes a professional in the future.  The previous loan helped him a lot to cover schooling costs and to have resources available to help his family with what they need.  This new loan is to pay the final secondary school tuition fees for his niece.

loans.use: to pay her niece's tuition fees.

loans.name: German Santiago

texts.es:
Germán, quiere comprar laminas y cemento para la vivienda, por eso se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, ya que el anterior le sirvió para los insumos agrícolas, estas inversiones que realiza le ayudan para fortalecer el negocio, y en este momento para mejorar la vivienda. Con esto él quiere brindar a su familia una mejor comodidad y seguridad.
Germán esta agradecido, ya que en los pagos del prestamo anterior se atraso y por lo mismo dudo para solicitar otra vez, gracias Dios se le dio la oportunidad, esperando que esta vez no pasen percanses y pueda pagar puntualmente.
texts.en:
Germán wants to buy metal sheeting and cement for his house so has decided on a new loan since the previous one helped him get farm supplies.  These investments he makes help him strengthen the business and at present to improve his house.  He wants to provide his family with better comfort and security this way.

Germán is grateful because he was late with some of the previous loan payments so he was hesitant to request again but thank God he was given another opportunity and he’s hoping this time not to have any misfortunes and to be able to pay punctually.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: La socia Maritza continua con su negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra al por mayor materiales para construir como cemento, arenas, ormigon, ladrillos, piedras, cascajo entre muchos otros materiales, la socia tiene 8 años en este negocio, ella desea seguir creciendo y tiene ya sus contratas de materiales ella es muy cotizada en la zona y desea en esta ocación invertir el prestamo para amortizar la compra de materiales que le llegan en camión en la siguiente semana, ella cuanta con un monto y requiere para aumentar a su capital de trabajo el prestamo requerido. Ls socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, ormigon, arena, ladrillos. la socia desea en un futuro cercano poder jubilarse y seguir con la compra y venta de materiales porque ya le gusto el negocio y no quiere fallar a sus clientes.
texts.en: Maritza continues with her business selling building materials and supplies.  She buys building materials like cement, sand, concrete, bricks, stone and gravel, among many others at wholesale.  She’s been in this business 8 years and wants to continue growing.  She already has contracts for materials.  She’s highly sought after in the zone and wants on this occasion to invest the loan to pay off the delivery of materials that will arrive by truck next week.  She has a certain amount available but needs to increase her working capital with the required loan.  She is requesting the loan to invest in building materials like cement, concrete, sand and bricks.  In the near future, she’d like to retire and continue with the building supplies business because she’s gotten to like the business and does not want to fail her customers.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: Eduardo, nuevamente necesita otro crédito, porque quiere invertir en la agricultura y comprar más insumos como: abono, semilla, herbicidas, el objetivo de él es que este año sean mejores cosechas y poder obtener más  ganancias. Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a tener una mejor estabilidad económica  y no ha surgido ningún problema, y les  ha podido dar una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Eduardo needs another loan again because he wants to invest in farming and buy supplies like manure, seeds and herbicide.  His goal is that his harvests improve this year to obtain higher profits.  Previous loans helped him to have better economic stability and no problems arose; he’s been able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo, de 52 años, es una hombre muy bueno, honesto y trabajador. Es padre soltero de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo tres viven con él, ya que uno de ellos es mayor de edad y tiene su propia familia. El trabajo de Domingo consiste en el de transporte de carga y pasajero dentro y fuera de la ciudad, es una trabajo que le ha brindado muchos beneficios, entre ellos el crecimiento económico y la estabilidad del ingreso a su hogar. Lleva trabajando con su vehiculo ya por siete años, lo hace solo, y hasta el momento posee tres unidades y uno lo maneja él y los otros dos manejan sus dos hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder hacer sus cosas personales, además le permite disponer de su horario. Sin embargo su vehñiculos se 
empiezan a deteriorar y tiene que estar en constante mantenimiento mecánico. Este será el sexto crédito con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona muy puntual. Está feliz por la oportunidad que le darán para poder realizar una buena inversión, además está seguro de poder seguir cancelando sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas y repuestos para su mototaxi, también le hace falta un cambio total de llantas, tapizado de los asiento y del toldo, además desea asegurar sus vehículos.
texts.en:
Domingo, 52, is a very good, honest and hardworking man.  He’s a single father of four children.  Only three of them live with him because one of them is an adult and has his own family.  Domingo’s work consists in transporting cargo and passengers within and outside the city.  It’s a job that has brought him many benefits among which is economic growth and stable income for his home.  He’s been working with his vehicle for seven years; he works alone.  To date he owns three units.  He operates one of them and the other two are operated by his two sons.  What he likes about the work is that it leaves time for him to do his personal things plus it lets him manage his own time.

However, his vehicles are starting to wear down and need constant mechanical service.  This will be his 6th MFP loan.  He always stood out in his group as a very punctual person.  He’s happy for the opportunity he’ll be given to make a good investment.  Besides, he’s sure that he will be able to continue making his installment payments on time like he’s been doing to date.  He will use the requested amount to buy spare parts for his mototaxi.  It also needs to have a complete tire replacement, the seats need to be upholstered and it needs a shade; he also needs to insure his vehicles.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, tires, to upholster the seats, to buy a shade and insurance.

loans.name: Nelly Ernestina

texts.es:
Nelly, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella tiende una granja de cerdos, inicio con esta granja por el apoyo de su esposo, ya que siempre le apoya en sus proyectos, la granja la tiene en su casa, no cuenta con un horario fijo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y de concentrado, la compra le permitirá ampliar la granja, y estabilizar el negocio.
Su aspiración  es darse a conocer con más clientes, para que aumente la demanda y pueda crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Nelly lives with her husband and two children. She has a pig farm which she began with the support of her husband, who always supports her projects. The farm is at her house. She doesn’t work on a fixed schedule.

Nelly is applying for this loan in order to purchase pigs and feed. This will permit her to enlarge the farm and stabilize the business. Her goal is to become acquainted with more customers so that demand for her pigs increases and she can enlarge her microenterprise.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria, vive en casa propia junto a familia y cinco hijos, administra una tienda en el mercado municipal, donD. ofrece productos no perecederos y además verduras, este negocio lo heredo se su familia, lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. productos como arroz, aceite, harina para tortillas, cereales, esta compra le permitirá a Gloria abastecer el negocio, ya que en estos meses por asuntos D. maternidad se ha descuidado del negocio, por lo que espera después D. la inversión tener un mejor nivel en sus inventarios.
La Aspiración D. Gloria es que su negocio vuelva a ser fuerte y poder manejar bien el préstamo, para continuar con esta ayuda y mejorando el negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in her own house with her five children.  She manages a store in the municipal market where she sells non-perishables and vegetables.  She inherited the business from her family and she works there daily.

She is requesting a loan to buy products such as: rice, oil, flour for tortillas, and cereals.  With this purchase Gloria will stock her business since in the last months, family problems have maD. her neglect it.  She hopes that after the purchases she will have a better level of inventory.

Gloria’s dream is that her business becomes strong again.  She wants to handle the financing well and with this aid, continue and improve the business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, flour for tortillas and cereals

loans.name: Elba Concepcion

texts.es:
Elba, es comerciante, vive con su esposo, cuatro hijos, ella tiene experiencia en el negocio D. la venta D. verduras, este negocio lo tiene en el mercado, también sale a venD. D. forma ambulante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. verduras frescas: papas, plátanos, zanahorias, pepinos, tomates y cebollas, la compra le permitirá mejorar, abastecer el negocio y brindar una mejor atención a los clientes.
El propósito D. Elba es mejorar y convertirse en una microempresaria, teniendo una buena cantidad D. clientes y mejorando cada día su nivel D. vida con la D. su familia.
texts.en:
Elba is a merchant. She lives with her husband and four children. She has experience in the business of selling vegetables. She has her business at the market. She also sells on an itinerant basis.

Elba is applying for this loan in order to purchase fresh vegetables: potatoes, bananas, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions. This will allow her to improve and supply her business and offer better service to her customers. Elba’s goal is to improve her microenterprise and become a business which has a lot of customers. Each day she wants to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, bananas, carrots, cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Monica Dalila

texts.es:
Mónica, vive con su familia, su esposo es agricultor, y la demás familia le apoya, ella administra una tienda y venta de pupusas,  este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, lo atiende todos los días, la tienda desde muy temprano y la pupuseria por las tardes.
Actualmente quiere comprar mercadería para la tienda, aceite, huevos, queso, arroz, frijoles, condimentos, sopas, espaguetis, y demás productos que los clientes demandan.
Ella quiere solventar la situación de falta de mercadería, iniciando con este préstamo, espera que continúen mejor las ventas y que su condición cambie.
texts.en:
Mónica lives with her family.  Her husband is a farmer and the rest of her family support her.  She runs a store and sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  She started the business on her own initiative and works every day, opening the store early in the morning and the "pupuseria" in the afternoons.

Currently she wants to buy goods for the store such as oil, eggs, cheese, rice, beans, condiments, soups and spaghetti, as well as other items requested by the customers.

She hopes to resolve the problem of a lack of merchandise through this loan, hoping her situation will change and sales will increase in volume.

loans.use: To buy oil, eggs, cheese, rice, beans, condiments, soups and spaghetti.

loans.name: Save The Children Group

texts.en:
In this photo are the members of the “Save The Children” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. These entrepreneurs have requested for a loan of 1,900,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL) in order to further boost their respective businesses.

The leader of this group is Martha. Martha, 22, was born in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. Currently, she is residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary school. Martha has been a businesswoman for many years now, selling clothing. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy jeans, t-shirts, shoes, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shoes, etc. in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, es carpintero, vive con sus padres y una hermana mejor, tiene aproximadamente 4 años de estar dedicado a la carpintería, fabricando ataúdes de madera, trabaja por contrato, todos los días de la semana.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera de cedro, pino, laurel, y pagar por el mantenimiento de las herramientas, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener todo lo necesario en el taller y que sus herramientas estén listas en buenas condiciones, esto permitirá que su taller aumente la capacidad para hacer muebles y ataúdes.
Las aspiraciones de Juan son, aumentar su potencial, darse a conocer más en el mercado, aumentando los cliente y la demanda, para hacer más exitoso su trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan is a carpinter and lives with his parents and younger sister.  For approximately four years he has worked making wood coffins.  He works on a contract order basis every day of the week.

He is requesting a loan to buy cedar, pine and laurel wood and pay for the tool maintenance.  The loan will help him keep his workshop up to date and his tools in good working condition.  In this way he can increase capacity to make furniture and more coffins.

Juan wants to increase his business potential and become more well-known in the market.  He hopes this will increase his customer base and product demand so his business is more successful.

loans.use: To buy cedar, pine, and laurel wood.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La socia sigue con su negocio propio de compra y venta de cosmeticos por catalogos, ella sigue trabajando y le va muy bien, la socia trabja en esto desde hace 15 años y como promotora de belleza le han dado muchos regalos por el desempeño que puso y continua haciendo de este negocio una empresa personal, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de cosmeticos como esmaltes de uñas, lapiz labiales, perfumes, cremas y otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza para teneren su stock.
texts.en: The member continues buying and selling cosmetics through catalogue and business is going well.  She has been in this activity for fifteen years and as a beauty saleswoman has received many gifts for her hard work.  She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics such as nail polish, lipstick, perfumes, creams and other items to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as nail polish, lipstick, perfumes, creams and other items.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Emilio, tiene 62 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos de 14, 18, 20 y 23 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian en la escuela, vive en una aldea de Azacualpa, Intibucá, una zona apta para la agricultura.

Don Emilio, se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como papas, brócoli y coliflor, también tiene la producción de maíz y frijoles para consumo y venta. Esta actividad la realiza él personalmente y con la ayuda de su familia. En los días que tiene libre hace trabajo jornal para recibir otros ingresos.

Anteriormente solicito dos créditos de forma grupal y ahora a decidido solicitar un préstamo individual, todos han sido para invertir en el cultivo, dándole el mantenimiento y asistencia debida para lograr una buena cosecha. Los préstamos los ha pagado muy bien. Cuando pague este préstamo va solicitar otro para ampliar la producción.
De las ganancias cubre gastos de educación de sus hijos y gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sr. Emilio is 62 years old, married, and has four children (ages 14, 18, 20, and 23). Two of his children are in school. Emilio lives in the neighborhood of Azaculapa, Intibucá, an area that is suitable for agriculture.

Don Emilio grows vegetables such as potatoes, broccoli, and cauliflower. He also produces corn and beans for personal consumption and for sale. Emilio does the work personally with the help of his family. When he has days that are free, Emilio works as a laborer to earn extra income.

The two previous loans he requested were with a group, so he is now requesting an individual loan. All of his loans were invested in his crops by providing maintenance and attention in order to achieve a good harvest. The loans were repaid successfully. After he repays this loan, Emilio will request another one so that he can expand production.

With his earnings, Emilio is able to pay for his children’s educational expenses and the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es: José, nuevamente solicita otro crédito, porque quiere mejorar su negocio y comprar materia prima como: panes, salsa, carne, mostaza, mayonesa, tortillas para tacos, el objetivo de él es ofrecerles a su clientela más variedad en sus productos. Los financiamientos anteriores le ayudaron a mejorar en los ingresos y aumentar en clientes, esto le ayudo a aprovechar las fiestas del pueblo en cual aumento la venta y le ayudo a tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting another loan because he wants to improve his business and buy supplies such as bread, sauce, meat, mustard, mayonnaise, and tortillas for making tacos. His goal is to offer his customers a wider variety of products.

The previous loans have helped to improve his earnings and increase his customer base. By utilizing this loan, José can take advantage of the town festivals in order to increase his sales. This will help him earn more income to help his family.

loans.use: to buy bread, sauce, meat, mustard, mayonnaise, and tortillas.

loans.name: Xiomara Carina

texts.es: Xiomara Carina de 34 años es una madre ejemplar. Tiene 2 hijos, ella es sub directora de una escuela. Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que quiere realizarle mejoras a su vivienda como cemento, bloques, arena y otros productos.  Le gusta su trabajo, pues se siente realizada por ello desea este crédito que le será muy beneficioso.
texts.en:
Xiomara Carina is 34 years old and an exemplary mother. She has two children and works as an assistant principal at a school. Xiomara is requesting this loan so that she can buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, sand, and other supplies. She wants to make improvements to her home.

Xiomara enjoys her job and says that she finds her work fulfilling. She hopes this loan will be of great benefit.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, and other supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: José, debido a la época de noviembre y diciembre se decidió a tener otro crédito, porque quiere  mejorar su granja y comprar pollos de engorde pequeños para crecerlos y tenerlos listos para la época que mas se vende en la Navidad.El prestamo anterior le ayudo comprar un buen numero de pollo y alimentos, otro le sirvi para la compra de un horno con la idea de hacer pan para ir generando más ingresos, este avance le permitió que su familia mejore cada día económicamente.
texts.en:
José decided to request another loan for the season of November and December. He wants to improve his farm and buy young chickens for fattening so that they will be ready in time for Christmas, the season when he sells the most.

His previous loan helped him to buy a large number of chickens and enough feed. Another loan helped him to buy an oven so that he could make bread as a way of generating more income. This venture will help his family improve financially each day.

loans.use: to buy chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Blanca Egdomilia

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, vive con sus hijas D. 21, 19 y 16 años D. edad, ella aprendió el negocio por cuenta propia, desD. hace cuatro años atienD. el negocio.
Ella está solicitando préstamo para la compra mercadería como: arroz, papel y  carteras, esta inversión le ayudará para mejorar el negocio y poder atender a la clientela.
La aspiración D. blanca está en darle el estudio y a sus hijas para que puedan superarse, teniendo mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Blanca sells basic necessities. She lives with her daughters (ages 21, 19, and 16). Blanca learned this traD. on her own and has been in business for four years.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, paper, and wallets. This investment will help to improve her business so that she can serve her customers. Her aspiration is to proviD. her daughters with an education so that they can be successful and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy rice, paper, and wallets.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 46 años y vive en la aldea de Candelaria Togopala en el municipio de Intibuca.  Junto con su esposa Felipa, tiene 6 hijos de 14 a 22 años de edad. Los tres menores están en nivel educativo y los demás ya pasaron de la edad escolar. 

Desde su adolescencia, don Jose se ha dedicado a la agricultura. En actualidad, cultiva su propio terreno junto con Felipa. La pareja especializa en la siembra y producción de papa, maíz, frijoles y hortalizas. 

Don Jose ha sido cliente de ODEF desde 2008 y ha manejado 4 ciclos de crédito con la institución demostrando un buen comportamiento de pago. Con el crédito actual de L5,000, Jose va a comprar fertilizante y fungicidas para el mantenimiento de los cultivos de zanahoria y papa. Tiene planeado continuar el mismo ritmo de producción de sus cosechas para darle estabilidad a su familia. Espera que no haya pérdidas de la producción agrícola y que aumente la producción.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Candelaria Togopala in the town of Intibuca. He and his wife Felipa have six children between the ages of 14 and 22. The three youngest children are in school while the others have exceeded school age.

Since he was a teenager, Don Jose has engaged in farming. He and Felipa currently own a piece of land. They specialize in planting and producing potatoes, corn, beans, and vegetables.

Don Jose has been a client of ODEF since 2008. He has participated in four loan cycles and has demonstrated a good payment history. With this current loan of 5000 HNL, Jose will buy fertilizers and fungicides so that he can maintain his carrot and potato crops. He plans to continue the same production cycle of crops so that his family can have stability. He hopes to avoid any crop losses and be able to increase production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
